Actual Review


I don't even know where to start with this anime. I got a lot of work to do and this was such a great show, I'd rather not squander its name but I have to get this out to as much people as possible. This has got to be one of the most enjoyable animes that I have ever watched. Let's just use "bullet points," I think this will make this review go faster and get to the point.


- Comedic: This anime had a very comedic and humorous aspect to it. I do not recall a single episode having a scene I did not laugh at. It plays with the Ecchi (perverted) aspect of the show very well turning it into something comedic and enjoyable to watch. The show also has a good and natural flow to it. You know the animes where the comedy just feels too forced? This anime gets it comedic sense through how people interact with each other, it truly makes you like you're watching real life scenarios (dramatized a little of course) and no one can see you. 


- Ecchi!!: This anime doesn't hesitate to make fast progress, you know, those shows that give you a peck AT BEST towards the end. This anime gets straight to the point but has a good rhythm to it. Nothing feels rushed and nothing feels too slow, you feel like as if they're making good and sincere progress.


- Love and the minds of the characters: All throughout the show, you get to hear what Yamada (girl protagonist) and Kosuda (male protagonist) are thinking, giving you a good insight into the minds of the people as they're in the situation. At the same time, they do it so (again) naturally and normally that I didn't realize they were doing it until I had finished the show. It gives a nice element to the show, comedic, realistic, and a good insight into what the two were thinking at different moments. I applaud this aspect as not many generic romcoms dive into this, the most you'll get is a contrived and overtly emotional thought that's just too blatant and obvious. 


Overall, this show was just great and absolutely amazing to watch, very comedic, very humorous, very enjoyable. It does dive into the topic of sex frequently though, so if you're turned off by that kind of stuff it's better to stay away from this. It also has a nice story between these two, as an overlying outline for the whole story. The overall character development between the two were also outstandingly executed, however I sort of wish they dove into the lives of Kosuda and Yamada at the very least. However, I believe they wanted to keep the show at a comedic stand-point, none the less, I gave "character" a 9 for that reason and also I feel I might be too biased towards the anime. The content is great, the overall structure and plot for the anime was great, and most of all, it was incredibly enjoyable.

At the time that I watched it, B Gata H Kei was one of the most ecchi, borderline hentai series that I had seen (up there with Kiss X Sis and Yosuga no Sora). Obviously, newer shows have eclipsed even this, but not always in a good way... Despite the strongly-ecchi nature, they've made the show into an interesting comedy about a girl looking for sex buddies, and is yet still a virgin herself. As this is NOT a direct hentai, she is doomed to fail at her goal repeatedly in the show (though I guess they could have pulled a Yosuga no Sora...). Whatis surprising is that they were able to do all this while integrating a decent character development.


This is a good show if you're alright with occasional nudity and LOTS of fan service because of the portrayal and unique personalities of the characters. If you are easily offended by such NSFW scenes and the idea of a girl being a huntress, then maybe this isn't for you.


Animation:

The animation is up to date in terms of quality. Character designs are good (typical good looking female lead with a mediocre guy) and colors are full but not over-saturated. Nudity and suggestive sexual acts (such as groping, fondling, rubbing, etc.) are pervasive in this series. The nudity is partially covered by a demon icon in the TV releases, which is removed for the blue rays. My only qualm would be the plain, simple backgrounds used in the show.


Sound:

The OP is fairly good, a bit latin-y and a bit on the seductive side. The ED is a bit slower paced but also has a nice main melody. Both are sung by Yamada. The BGM is a bit distinctive in this series, heavily utilizing brass instruments, giving it a fun, flirtatious mood. Tamura Yukari does a great job on voicing Yamada (compare with Excel in Kurokami) giving her lots of energy and determination, the other VAs do a fine job but she's definitely the star in this.


Story:

So Yamada wants 100 sex buddies, but gets weirded out every time a guy approaches her. Therefore, she decides that her first "victim" must also be a virgin. Enter Kosuda, a ridiculously average looking dude that happens to meet all of Yamada's one criteria, he's a "cherry boy".


The story basically shows Yamada's attempts at approaching him and how the two eventually grow closer, despite uncountable numbers of misunderstandings and miscommunications. This is made even more fun due to Yamada's ego (wonder if most girls are like this) that prevents her from really ever being honest with Kosuda.


Underneath all the ecchiness, this is actually a fairly heartwarming story, think like those movies where a person is set up to "date" another person for money or on a dare, and actually end up liking them; this is one of those.


Character:

Yamada is easily one of the most entertaining characters in recent memory. You can tell what she wants but she won't ever say it directly. This combined with her seemingly unnatural sex drive makes her extremely impatient, especially when Kosuda doens't get her "hints", which often backfire and lead him to believe that she hates him. What is funny is that unlike many other harem series where the girl is just all over the guy all the time, Yamada is actually, realistically, hard to read.


Kosuda is a pretty bland character but you also have a very lively support group, including one of the first roles voiced by Mamiko Noto, where she isn't a timid, quiet person.


In any case, the resulting character development between Yamada and Kosuda is absolutely great in this series, if only there was a bit more depth with the other characters.


Value:

This was a very fun series to watch, not at work of course. You'll get a few laughs and wonder how this ended up on TV a few times as well. Then you ask yourself, would you really want to date a Yamada?

Wow, how do I even describe this series? Well, for starters, I had no idea it even existed until last week when a clip appeared on Funimations Youtube channel. I got curious and decided to watch said clip. Next thing I knew, I was looking for it on Netflix as advertised. Now, lets break this down, maybe that'll make it a bit easier to review without getting too cautious.
Well, B Gata H Kei(B Gata H Kei: Yamada's First Time in English) is a story about a girl whose sole purpose in High School is to bang 100 guys by the time she graduates from HighSchool. The only problem is that she has yet to lose her V-Card and is worried that any experienced guy would think less of her for not being experienced. And that brings us to the main story as well as our main cherry boy. The lead characters are Yamada and Kosuda. Honestly? I've never seen a series with characters quite like this(Well, except Panty & Stocking...). As mentioned before, Yamada is a Freshman in High School with the goal of banging 100 guys. The problem is that she REALLY cares what people think of her. She's the most popular girl in the school and just about every guy would do anything to even  be acknowledged by her and would bang her in a heartbeat. Kosuda on the other hand seems to be the most oblivious guy in the world. Yamada falls on him in a book store and decides that he will be her first time since she assumes he also still has his V-Card, which is more or less true. This leads to total confusion on his end as he attempts to try and tell what she's thinking. Aside from those two, there are the Eros Deities. Yeah, Ero should really be all you need to read in order to know where that is going. The Eros Deities are chibi versions of the characters they follow around and constantly break the fourth wall in comedic fashion. Yamada's Eros Deity looks like a chibi version of her, but wearing a robe, holding a staff, and has a white mustache for some reason. Kosuda's Eros Deity is, as you can assume by now, a mini version of himself which is wearing a yukata. However, unlike Yamada's Eros Deity who is constantly pushing her towards getting laid and depressed when everything falls apart time and time again, Kosuda's Deity has absolutely no faith in him, and shows more often than not to express Kosuda's arousal. So more or less a living censor bar that talks. Which is actually pretty funny.


Now, the premise of this series, Yamada wanting to get diddled, would make you think this is a hentai, it is in fact, not. So have no fears, you have absolutely nothing to worry about... well, except for the nude scenes which more or less turn this series into softcore porn. Normal late night television anime have been getting bolder and bolder as of late. This series more tame than High School DxD, but it does follow in those same ero footsteps. It's definitely tasteful, mature, and often times down right hilarious.


I honestly really enjoyed this series and I found next to nothing wrong with it. I liked the romance between Yamada and Kosuda. It was expected yeah, but that's typically how romance series are. You know who is going to end up together, but you don't know how they'll get there. That's the beauty of new stories. But at the same time, B Gata H Kei makes its intentions known from the start and throws you into complete disarray with the whole absurdity of it. It keeps you coming back each episode to find out if anything actually happens. The premise is completely different by comparison to other romance animes and so it stands out from the pack. Now, do I recommend sitting down with your lover and watching this? Er... probably not. Your girlfriend/boyfriend may start wondering if you're staring at him/her or the animated character on the screen at times. And that typically doesn't end well. So I advise against that. And this is definitely a series that is 50/50 when trying to watch it with family. Definitely Rated PG-13, but your family might begin questioning you as to why you're watching an animated television show with rare, but beautifully drawn and animated nudity. Yes, I just praised the rare nudity. Got a problem?


Aside from that, I just loved the interactions between the characters and the music was great. Though, one of my main gripes was the rivalry between Yamada and Kanojo. Kanojo can't stand coming in second behind anyone. And while the rivalry had its moments and seemed good on paper... I almost felt like it didn't need to exist. I mean to each their own, but the series probably would've been fine without it. That's just my two cents though.


As far as the dub was concerned, it was perfect. I didn't find any out of place voices and the fact that the actors were willing to say half the shit that they did made my jaw drop. I kind of almost want to compare the dub to the subtitles. Something practically tells me that half this shit was exclusive to the English Dub, and most likely the better for it to be honest. I'm just so glad that Funimation got the license. If Sentai had gotten it, the dub probably would have been mediocre and not even close to being as funny, and at the same time I'm glad Aniplex didn't get it because I really hate paying high prices for quality series. Funimation is a happy medium.


So overall, and I really hope I didn't spoil anything for you and if I did I apologize heavily, B Gata H Kei was just the refreshing anime that I need to see. It wasn't flawless, but it damn well could have been. The characters are great, the music is nice, the art is very well done, the story was fantastic, and I really wish they had made a second season because 12 episodes is depressing. Yeah the story flowed great and ended on a great note, but you just know that there's still a whole 'nother year and half left of their High School careers. I wanna see what happens next and watch the hilarity ensue. Maybe I should become an Eros Deity in my spare time. Seems like a far more exciting job.

The story line of this anime is pretty unique if you ask me.  At first you might wonder how in the world can you make an anime that is about a girl that want's to have 100 sex friends, and yet at the same time you're not about to watch a hentai?!  Well it may seem confusing at first, but after a while you realize that the anime is actually more of a romantic / comedy.  The story quickly drifts away from 100 and focuses on the who will be the first.

Out of all the characters in the show only three have so called "sex gods".  These "sex gods" help narrate the story, and always have some kind of comment to say.  Usually negative comments about the character.  I would say about 1/4 of the anime is directed by the sex gods.  The main character Yamada is by far the biggest pervert in the show.  She always thinks about perverted things, and even if it is something that is not perverted she will think of a way to make it sexual in her mind.  The other characters don't have much that make them stand out as much as Yamada, so I won't talk about them.  (There is a certain someone that is also pretty weird but if I say more that might ruin the surprise)


This was a very good ecchi in my opinion.  I mean the main character is a girl, who thinks of nothing but sex, decently cute, loads of perverted things going on, on top of the fact that multiple girls like Kosuda (the main guy character).  What more could you ask for?

So i read the premise of this story, or the synopsis if you want to call it dat. *Smirk*
*cough* It sounds pretty intelligent, interesting, and not sexual at all by any mean. (sarcasm)

Despite how troubling it's to have to deal with 100 sex friend and keepyour relationship with them (I mean, some people take love seriously and may see sex friend as something intimate instead. Like love for instance). This anime is not really about acting like a slut in front of everyone that she meets. She herself is still very pure, and unadulterate despite how lewd, and pompous she is when it comes to her own beauty in the eyes of others. Tbh, i cringed when i first see the first episode. Not only did they choose the most dullest male love interest that will last for the rest of the episodes. He's one of those generic, loser-type of male love interest. This peeved me for just alittle just before i start realizing that he really does capable of doing something that most generic MC doesn't have the balls to do. Though, in a very "idk wtf im doing" sense. 


But nonetheless, this anime has nothing to do with sex (tho there are ecchi, nudity and some foreplay in the last few eps) because of how inexperienced and shy, or tsundere our heroine is with pervy minds. The comedy of this series stem from that. But dont run away, or watch the anime with the single minded though that "since the premise is fucked up" i will go all feminism against it, or look at only the bizarre things that already has me despise the anime just because of the pervy female protagonist. Just watch it with disinterest (this word is not the same as uninterested). Tbh i have fun watching this anime. Plus i finish watching it within merely 4 days as i procrastinate from my studies, and my free time of doing something else, just to watch this fucking hilarious anime (tho cringey at first).


All that asides, this anime really have nothing to do with having sex with 100 + men, or seeing our female protagonist going all slutty and getting all the guys that she sees. It's less stupid, and sexual to the point that we could just call this a hentai like premises. However, the anime doesn't really move its story along those path. It actually went into the opposite direction, given that she suddenly experienced love with someone who she doesn't really expecting to fall in love with. Even though her true purpose was to have sex with someone, while it's a feeling that devoid of love, but self satisfaction only. She ended doing the exact opposite, so the central focus of the story is more like a love triangle like romance. 


And obviously, this anime isn't mean't to be watch by new anime watcher (unless they're a perv xd). If you don't to get too weird out. Try watching some generic, and less heavy, or sexual anime content first. Then slowly progresses to something abit more intense with its fanservice, and stupid as premises, with the same setting. But hey, this anime has some pretty entertaining comedy. Not in the aspect of its pervy jokes, or sexual implication or acts. It's just the desperate loli, comedy,and the relationship that's overall fun to watch.

The story of B Gata H Kei is about a girl who wants to "bang 100 men." So you can already tell what kind of show this'll be: an ecchi anime for the perverts, comedy anime for those with bad tastes of humor, and a shitty slice of life that nothing ever progresses in until the end where they rush it. The pacing is meh, with every episode having its own little plot because it's episodic. The comedy never gets a proper punchline and the delivery is bad with the voice actors (for english dub watchers.) The jokes are told to be bold and funnybecause how ridiculous the situation during sex is, normally this would work, but the jokes are more slapstick humor than anything subtle. Instead of NHK's humor, where the Main Character uses a tissue when he finds something arousing, they don't go anywhere with it.


The artstyle is nothing special, but it adds nudity now. So mature, huh?


The sound design is nice and isn't noticeable, especially since this is a comedy.


The characters are bland and they don't get any real development, I can't see a damn change from Takashi. Yamada seems to be getting characterization like normal, but you really dislike her in the show. The ecchi fanservice ruins the pacing, but this is what I asked for so that makes the anime immune to criticism of fanservice now.


I didn't enjoy anything as it had no real motivation to go anywhere. It was just a comedy that never appealed or was funny to me, comedy is subjective so watch the first 3 episodes and see for yourself. But I personally, disliked everything in this anime.

Before I get into anything, I want to let it be known that I love ecchi, so my opinions will come from a different angle than a lot of anime purists, which is okay. I really enjoyed B Gata H Kei. It's short, but extremely funny and filled with innuendo. Definitely worth a watch if you enjoy these types of anime, but stay away if you're the type that's easily offended by fan service or raunchy comedy.
Story: The story is simple enough, the main character Yamada is a pervy girl who dreams of having tons of sex friends. Another way to say this is she'sthe hottest girl in school and her goal is to be a huge slut. The problem is that she's totally inexperienced, thinks her vagina looks funny, and doesn't want her first time to be with someone more experienced with her. As such, she bumps into what seems to be the most boring guy in the school, guesses correctly that he's a virgin, and makes him her first goal. 


It doesn't really work out as she planned however, and the show quickly becomes a romance.  Each episode inches her closer and closer to her first time, but in true anime fashion is always cut short by some kind of ridiculous outside interference. In that regard, it's pretty stereotypical. However it's got a lot of comedic value to it, and I found myself laughing out loud plenty. While the premise of the show is pretty unique, it doesn't take itself too seriously either. 


My biggest complaint is that the episode count doesn't seem nearly enough for the amount of time that passes. Due to almost every episode being some kind of holiday, something like a year and a half are covered in only 12 episodes. (SPOLER HERE) That's a year and a half of a romance consisting of 3 or 4 actual "Dates" involved, and I'm pretty sure it takes them a year to go from their first kiss to their second. (END SPOILER) The pacing is definitely off as far as that's concerned, and makes the whole thing feel a bit awkward.


6/10 


Art: The art is actually really beautiful. The landscapes alone are fantastic. Character design ranged from outstanding, to generic, to bland - but all well drawn. I do feel that much of the generic or bland characters are drawn that way purposefully, as it's part of who they are (see: Kosuda). Still, it would have been nice to see at least some pizaz when it comes to the supporting cast.


7/10 


Sound: Pretty average honestly, nothing that really stood out either positively or negatively. 


5/10


Character: The characters are for the most part well done and full of personality. Yamada and Kusoda in particular develop really well, though admittedly they're basically the only ones who do. That's fine though, considering it's a short anime about a long romance between those two characters, who are explicitly inexperienced from the start. The characters do exactly what they're supposed to, fill whatever niche they need to (loli girl, tough teacher, wealthy rival, quiet nerdy girl with big boobs and glasses), but not much more than that.


7/10


Enjoyment: I definitely enjoyed this anime, it's funny in all the right ways, and full of light fan service. My only gripe other than what I've stated previously  is that for this type of show, waiting until episode 12 to show any nipples seems really weird. For an ecchi like this that relies so heavily on it's perverse theme, that seems like an odd choice to make. While it does make the few bare-breasted shots feel more impactful,  it's more jarring than anything. 


I understand going with no-nubs art style when you're trying like hell to push the line as far as it can go without being pushed into the 18+ section like Kiss X Sis, but there's nothing really that hardcore for the majority of the season that would make that a concern. It really doesn't do the show many favors to just add them in at the end like that, especially considering I had just watched 11 episodes without them and wasn't even thinking about it until I was reminded halfway in to episode 12. 


It is still a great success as a comedy though, and having a pervy female main character trying like hell to get laid is new, exciting, and highly entertaining.


7/10


Overall: I would definitely suggest this to anyone who enjoys comedy anime and isn't offended by sexual content in anime. It's not perfect, but it's amusing and unique, and in my opinion that's worth a watch. 


7/10

It is not the best of the genre, but really good, happily recommend to everyone. 15 year-old Yamada enters High School with the ambitious dream of having 100 casual sex friends. Unfortunately, she has no idea about anything related to sex or romance at all! B Gata H Kei has all it takes to be one of the worst, most unbearably shameless shows of all time, but it is from this very context that B Gata H Kei is so impressive. In the face of the most cunning serpent of temptation, the show stuck to good writing and clever entertainment to offer its viewers a genuinely good time. Taken as good natured fun, B Gata H Kei is a greatexample of good main characters not being annoying as hell.


More identified with projects like Aria and sketchbook ~full colors~, HAL Film Maker is not known for ecchi love comedy. However, the professionalism and quality we've come to expect from the studio shines again in this show.


B Gata H Kei is floated by its solid cast and watchable main characters. Yamada (cv. Yukari Tamura) is funny and likable. Her perverted, aggressive nature makes the show interesting and her naivete makes the show funny. There's a little boke/tsukommi routine going on with her friend Takeshita Miharu (cv. Horie Yui), who doesn't really have much other role in the show. Even considering this, Miharu delivers great comedy and is truly a great friend character. The male lead, Kosuda Takashi (cv. Abe Atsushi) is a meek and unconfident man because of how "plain" he looks. I feared another annoying passive male lead but much to my surprise, the character develops as the show progresses. It's not much, but in the context of these kinds of shows, holy crap.


What kind of state is the genre in when two main protagonists not being one-dimensional douchetards is considered "unique"? But while Kosuda and Yamada are in denial of the relationship and everything, the annoying frustration never spills over in your face or ruins the fun. It's as if the two were "It's complicated" on Facebook but everyone knows what's going on anyways.


Kanejou Kyoka (cv. Kobayashi Yuu) is a good antagonist for this show. She's cruel and sinister while also being relatively funny. Her role in the show is surprisingly subdued, and though she was quite an interesting character, I don't mind too much. An often overlooked character in this show is Miyamo Miyu (cv. Hanezawa Kana), the shy osananajimi character who is innocent and naive, but has a crush on Takashi. She foils Yamada well and her helplessness is dialed up enough to make you kind of root for her, but not enough to be considered annoying. The conspicuous lack of a major love triangle between Yamada and Miyu keeps the show from turning into a pointless haremfest. A character I would liked to see more of, however, was Yamada's little sister, Chika (cv. Shimoda Asami). She would have been a nice contrasting character or served some good plot points. Misato Mimi (cv. Iwasaki Ai), the flat chested genkigal no one care about, is also a pretty good and memorable background character.


An overarching theme in B Gata H Kei is how surprisingly realistic the show seems. You'd imagine a show with a predatory female lead and an antagonist with a mansion on top of a mansion would have absolutely absurd, but so much of the core actions of the plot seem natural. Yamada and Kosuda develop as character and the relationship, though awkward and full of pitfalls, is really fun to watch.


B Gata H Kei is surprisingly intelligent, uncannily funny, and truly entertaining. It does big things and small things well -- poking fun at the various institutions Japanese youth are familiar with, like the idea of liberal fornication in love hotels to the overly strict homeroom teacher. The OP and ED are Yukari Tamura singles and are pretty tasteful and pleasant. No complaints about the art or animation, and I thought the character design was good to make characters look rather simple. The show is enjoyable to just sit back and watch as the characters bumble around strange situations. The fanservice is there but it's not trashy, tasteful even. I would actually say that the show probably needed more.

B Gata H Kei, or directly translated, "B-cupped Slut", is basically proof of the saying: "Don't judge a book by it's cover" (or description, in this case). Honestly, I was completely surprised by this anime. I decided to watch it purely because it seemed incredibly weird, and while I'm not going to deny that it is strange, it's a lot more than meets the eye. Don't be afraid, my friend. 
Story:
Unique, for one. Finally someone addresses that females have sexual desire too. Yamada is horny as hell and not afraid to show it. So what does she do? Sets out to bang 100 dudes. Andwhile she might not get far in that goal, it's still really entertaining. I'm just warning you though, this is NOT a fanservice anime. In fact, there's practically none at all besides some bikini shots and 1 or 2 boob scenes. The only reason this is an ecchi is because of the topics it deals with, not because of porny images. So if you're looking for some jack-off material, skip this. 


Art:

Pretty good. I don't really notice anime art unless it's really good or really bad, and ecchi anime are not known for their incredible animation. 


Sound:

Same as art, really. Background music didn't detract from any of the scenes, but it wasn't too memorable either. The op was... interesting. How is it possible to sing that high? Despite that, it was catchy and I never skipped it, lol.


Character:

Ah yes, the shining category of this anime. Yamada is incredible, to say the least. And best of all, she's real. Never before have I seen a female character portrayed as horny realistically, yet this anime does it perfectly. Yamada is constantly coming up with schemes to seduce boys, which of course isn't that realistic, but the way she reacts when they work is. Deep down, Yamada is still a little unsure if she's ready to lose her virginity, a worry of all teenage girls. It can make her actions seem all the more strange, but any person who's ever been a teen will understand. She's relatable and funny. And best of all, she isn't over-sexualized.

Her victim, Kosuda, is also a good character. Unlike many other anime guys, there's really nothing incredible about him. He's average looking, awkward, and shy. Which is actually what the majority of teen boys are. By being such an average guy, it makes him all the more unique in the anime genre. He may also give some boys out there hope for scoring a pretty lady, haha. 

The other characters aren't focused on too much, but they all add to Kosuda and Yamada. Yamada's best friend is the voice of reason, helping her to see how ridiculous Yamada can be at times. Miyano and Kanejo, Yamada's rivals, are extreme opposites and very entertaining. Miyano is an extremely shy neighbor of Kosuda, and the only reason Yamada thinks she's a rival is because of her... well... enormous boobs. Kanejo, on the other hand, is obsessed with being the prettiest girl in their school and is constantly trying to dethrone Yamado. Hilarity ensues.

Side note on Kanejo: she's one of the only really fucked up things in this anime. She's... how do I say this? A fangirl of her own brother. She literally has a room filled with paraphernalia with his face on it. Not sure why this aspect of her was included, but it does make her less hate-able because you know how messed up she really is, lmao. 


Enjoyment:

Immense. The incredible cast, unique storyline, and great voice acting all add up to one of the most entertaining anime I've ever watched. 


Overall:

B Gata H Kei is an anime I would recommend to any teen or young adult. It's relatable and well-written. It defies all stereotypes anime usually uses and instead creates a funny and honest comedy. Of course, it was probably broadcasted at 2 am in Japan, which is such a shame because this show is really for teens, not creepy otaku. I'm tempted to start a petition to use this anime in sex-ed. 


P.S. Going to warn you now, Yamada does NOT ever actually lose her virginity in this anime. If you want to see that happen, read the manga, which details all of Yamada and Kosuda's sexual adventures. ;)

One of the best things about this anime, other than it’s sexually charged plot line, is the banter between each of the characters. Comedic timing in anime is typically a difficult thing to do, requiring the voice actor to not only be immersed in their role, but to have chemistry with other voice actors. Frequently in B Gata H Kei, the majority of the laughs not only come from the line the character is saying, but how the line is being said. One of my favorite things about this anime is that a well-timed one liner can come from almost any of the characters inthe scene. The best dialogue occurs between Yamada, and her best friend Miharu Takeshita. Their back-and-forth banter over Yamada’s statements and motivations, each of them being justified in feeling so, never fails to deliver a chuckle. More humor can be found coming from Yamada’s Eros Diety, who frequently “breaks the fourth wall” to deliver a snarky rebuttal about Yamada’s actions, or even Kosuda’s big sister, who gives interesting backstory on Kosuda while at the same time subtly helping Yamada become closer in achieving her goal of sleeping with Kosuda.


Visually, the anime is very aesthetically appealing. Particularly, how the animation aids to the comedy. In one instance, Yamada is posing in her bathing suit in front of the mirror bragging about how nobody can resist her, and “B-Cup” flashed on the screen in referencing her boob size, which she wastes no time in punching it off screen. Or when she initially looks for Kosuda, but is too busy consumed by her thoughts to notice that he sits right next to her, a sarcastically drawn dashed line points directly to him. This style happens many times an episode, and entices as just many laughs as the characters, as they sometimes don’t even have to speak for you to find humor in what’s happening. What really stands out to me are the character designs, for as few characters that really matter for the majority of the episodes. Yamada’s design of her fair colored skin, yellow sweater vest, and blonde hair with her blue eyes and blue accent colors makes her look equally as attractive to the viewer of the anime as she does other characters. Her design always keeps her as the center of attention, even if she isn’t the scenes main focus. Takeshita’s white and dark blue character design look equally as good, (maybe I have a soft spot for dark haired anime girls, who knows?) but doesn’t take any attention off of Yamada. The same goes for Kosuda. He is in his school uniform the majority of the anime, looks plain and average enough to Yamada’s eyes, yet his design is effective enough to be differentiated in a crowd from each of his other male classmates.


The pacing and subsequent climax of each episode is what keeps you watching for hours on end. Each episode brings the same task as the last. Yamada needs to have sex with Kosuda. Period. With this motivation known, and repeated about 90 times an episode, you keep this in mind for scenes where the anime appears to veer off-course for a moment, when it appears that Yamada might be developing real feelings for Kosuda, or she pushes him away because she realizes that her approach has again failed her. As the scenes flow very well together, both Yamada and Kosuda build up their tension towards the climax and overall goal of the episode, whether it be Yamada wanting Kosuda to grab her breast in the dark film room, or each of them wanting to kiss in the local makeout park. And in those climaxes, the tension holds strikingly well. Between Yamada and Kosuda, we know what each character wants, and as each step they take on the ladder to sex fails, somehow you’re still able to hold out hope that maybe, maybe, they’ll get it together.  In those moments where those two do happen to reach that goal, for example kiss each other, their inner monologues both become focused on what they think the other thinks of what they’re doing. This leaving many awkward moments for all of us figure out how they truly feel about what the other is actually doing. When they succeed, or end up on the same page, usually this ended with me throwing my arms up in triumph screaming “yes! He touched her boobs!” Yet their failures are also hysterical, as they have to start at square one the next episode, and have the most dramatic reactions to failure.


My one complaint about this anime is Kosuda. Not in a manner of  “He isn’t good enough for Yamada!” But Kosuda isn’t as interesting as he feels he could be. Don’t get me wrong, he’s a very likeable character, and humorous in his own right. However it feels as if you plugged another awkward male into the role and gave him the daunting task of navigating thorough Yamada’s mixed signals for 12 episodes, the results would be about the same. However, this anime isn’t one to be taken too seriously, or seriously at all for that matter, so I can easily ignore this. Or this might be one issue that only I really care about, so feel free to discard this complaint.

Upon first reading the description of this show you may find yourself asking the questions: "Why would I want to bother watching anime about a slut?" Trust me I asked myself this very same question as I began watching this series, but I found that the description is a little misleading. 
The story itself is not just about Yamada gathering 100 different sex partners, there is actually a romance tucked into that. We watch as she goes from just wanting to have sex as quickly as possible (and doing so in the most hilarious and clumsy ways) to falling in love with the last personin her class you would think she'd choose. \n\n
B Gata H Kei has a slow to build romantic plot with a whole lot of comedy thrown into the mix. I found it a little refreshing to watch something this season that wasn't over the top ecchi/fanservice and actually gave me some laughs. This is a good series for people who don't want a serious romantic thrill; that will leave you rooting for the main characters to hurry up and do it at the end.

A cute teenage girl (who knows it, too) who dreams of sleeping with 100 guys, but worries about what she looks like naked and is hopelessly awkward when it comes to displaying affection?  Count me the hell in.
_______________________________________________________________________________________________
"B Gata H Kei," or "Yamada's First Time" is one of those shows that I initially went into not expecting much from, but emerged pleasantly surprised.  I came across it on Netflix one day and decided to queue it up with some friends, fully expecting to laugh at copious panty shots and anime boob physics.  What I got (along with the surprisingly minimal fanservice) wasan incredibly heartfelt, but still funny, story about teenage sexuality and the desire to be loved.


Story:  7/10

The premise itself isn't too hard to understand.  Yamada's goal has always been to sleep with 100 guys upon entering high school, but she wants he first time to be with another virgin.  She finds a totally plain guy (who she assumes is a virgin due to his plainness) and settles on him.  In the process f trying to seduce him, the two actually end up falling in love with each other.  This is undoubtably a storyline thats been done before, but with the roles reversed.  Seeing a teenage girl who is totally unapologetic about her sexuality is so, so rare.  It's unique as well as wonderfully empowering.


Art: 7/10 

I'm not sure how to describe it other than "very 2010."  The style and colors all match up very closely with other 2010 anime.  It didn't really bring anything new to the table in those regards, but it definitely isn't bad, either.  The colors can be pretty bright and hard on the eyes at times, though.


Sound: 6/10

While not bad, the sound is one of the weaker point of the show.  The opening and ending themes are quite generic and forgettable.  The background music, which is bubbly and upbeat most of the time, fits the series but is nothing noteworthy.  Netflix has the dubbed version, which I had no problem with, so I can't say I know much about the original voice acting.


Character: 9/10

Definitely the strongest point of the series.  Each character is very memorable, including the sideliest of side characters (shoutout to my main girl Misato).  Even Kosuda, who is the epitome of unimpressive anime guy, becomes interesting when he interacts with other characters.

Our titular character is definitely the strongest, with a firm personality, set of values, and goals.   Yamada is a great lead to the show, and wildly entertaining to follow.


Enjoyment: 9/10

Even with such a simple and frankly juvenile concept, it's incredibly well-written and even though I often don't "get" Japanese humor, I found myself laughing out loud usually several times each episode.  I have a really hard to marathoning anime in one sitting, but if I was able to, this is one of those shows that I definitely would.  It's a fun and overall very sweet ride.


Overall: 8/10

I can understand why people would be wary of this show.  The cover art and description make it sound like a disgustingly sexualized story about a teenage girl.  The fanservice is definitely there (you get a full boob shot at one point), but it's always relevant in the context of what's happening and isn't distracting. With a character we don't see much of in other anime, it's unique and refreshing.  If you're not squeamish about the topic of sex, then this is a show that I would definitely recommend.

Enjoyment - I  really enjoyed this show a lot and recommend it to anyone thats ok with school anime and echii.

B Gata H Kei is a very enjoyable anime for anyone who is just looking for an all around good time.
The story is about a high schooler named Yamada and her quest to eventually sleep with 100 guys. When I first watched it, I couldn't look away. The interactions between all of the characters are hilarious to say the least. I found myself binging this show once I started because I lost track of time.
If you are looking for a great comedy, I have to highly recommend B Gata H Kei. Overall the show garners an 8/10 from me partly because I would have wanteda more conclusive ending to really put it over the top. However, if you are able to look past it and enjoy the journey along the way, it truly is a good time.

Oh, what have I gotten myself into. B Gata H Kei is an ecchi + romance comedy which managed to surprise many, including me in a way. Here is my review.
Art/Animation-
I don't think there is much to say here. I think the art and animation were good, nothing amazing though. There are these funny moments where the characters become like cartoons (smaller with a wierd face) which I think is a great addition to comedy anime. I have to note that some of the character designs were a bit too familiar, perhaps this was done on purpose. 
Sound- 
Once again I didn't find too muchhere, the soundtrack was pretty good but with nothing too memorable. Once again I don't judge the songs of the OP and the ED, as for their animation, it's pretty good as well. I don't like these kind of ED's though, not because of the animation or sound, but because not much is going on in them and even if the song is really good they are usually less popular because of the OP. This is the case in many anime, as I continue to mention. \n\n
Story- \n
This is the interesting part, as per usual. You usually don't expect a comedy show to have a good or even decent story, and you also can't expect much from the description of it. However behind all the comedy and fanservice there is actually a decent story that actually fits the comedy part. While it's not amazing or too unique it blends in with the funny parts so well, so i'm giving it a 7/10 instead of a 6/10. \n\n
Characters- \n
Most of the characters seem to be very stereotypical at first. This is not really wrong. However, these supporting characters are, while not the most original, pretty interesting, some even having some twists to them. Even the deuteragonist (who is a male) seems so normal and boring, it looks like it was done on purpose. However all of this characters are surrounding the main character, who is very unique (especially for a main character) and has really good development over the show, along with the other main character. While I believe some supporting characters were not important enough as they should have been, they are still important as a part of the story and all create for a funny and interesting combination. \n\n
Overall/Personal Opinion- \n
I have to say that shows like this are not my type, however I still managed to enjoy this one. While I would personally give it a 7/10 I can see what is good in it, and what made it so good in the eyes of people who do like these type of shows, so i'm giving it an 8/10. I reccomend you give it a try, especially if it interests you personally.

What I liked about this series was the realistic portrayal of wild teenage emotions. Of course it is exaggerated for comedic effect, but the idea is that a teenager can really want to have sex but is also really freaked out when it might actually happen. Sure, Yamada's goal of 100 sex partners is over-the-top, but it's just there to emphasize that girls can be sex obsessed, too. The series is really more about the young and innocent trying everything they can to experience sex for the first time, and mostly getting in their own way. Of particular note is the way the two maincharacters are constantly trying to guess what the other is thinking, and usually getting it wrong. That's life in a nutshell!\n\n
Otherwise the series was a fun and goofy comedy with a bunch of raunchy suggestive scenes. And supposedly the blu-ray version will be uncensored, so your sexy naked anime girls won't all be covered up by the ubiquitous Demon Seal brand logo!

My friend was the person that recommended this anime to me, but I'd been planning on reading the manga (but also never got around to it) in the first place. I just thought that the whole concept just seemed funny.
The truth is, you may think from the very beginning that the story is going to be dirty, thanks to Yamada's constant need to have sex, but what's so funny is that there are guys that are all over her all the time, but she can't GIVE it away. 
Every time that she has a chance to get sex, she just freaks out and calls thema pervert, but has these huge delirious ideas of what she'd like. The truth is, she'll talk about it throughout the whole series, but she's just a virgin, like everyone else. :3 \n\n
The story is outstanding and it certainly keeps you on your toes. The only really dirty part is on the 12th episode and even that's not that horrid. Still not advised for young children because this IS going to have a lot of language I certainly wouldn't want my future children to hear. xD

By looking at the cover of this anime I thought to my self that this would be another slice of life, romance school anime that would be good but could have been better. After watching the first episode, I was interested in how this would be played out, and I like how the creators wanted to take a different path for our female main character.
The story is basically about Yamada with a goal in high school, which is to have sex with 100 guys. Yep, 100 guys, and the fact that she's not the usual, clichéd Japanese girl who's in other anime makesB Gata H Kei a lot more interesting. Now that being said she wastes no time in getting this operation started, until she realized that she needs to lose her virginity first. So she puts back the 100 guy plan and looks for a virgin herself, and that's where she meets Kusuda. After meeting him, the anime goes on showing how the feelings they have for each other bloomed.\n\n
Now about the art and sound, I'm not really the type of person who will go into deep detail about these two but, the art in B Gata H Kei was great actually. In some anime the characters looks pretty plain, but in this every character had a unique quality in their appearance, except for Kusuda. I really disliked how he looked, he was very plain. \n
As for the sound the opening theme was perfect for this anime. The music they played through out scenes were well played, and some fit the right moment perfectly.\n\n
The characters in this were all likable, except for one of the main, which was Kusuda. I'm not really the type to beat up characters, especially in romance animes for being clueless but I have to say Kusuda is a complete no no. I mean it could've been because I watched this English dubbed instead or subbed, but I have to say that Kusuda's English voice acting was horrible. Other than that the characters were hilarious, and I liked all of them.\n\n
In the end I really did enjoy this anime, I entered it feeling unsure if I did, but it started off with comedy right off the bat, and that's why I gave enjoyment the score of 9, but overall I gave it an 8 because of Kusuda's voice acting, although his Japanese voice actor is probably a lot better. Overall I recommend this to other people, and yes ladies this is female friendly ^.^

Summary:
B gata H Kei is a Ecchi Romance Comedy Anime made by Hal Film maker and Localized by FUNimation, it is about a girl named Yamada who is entering High School and has a the dream of sleeping with over 100 guys before she graduates. Do to her insecurities about her body/being a virgin she rejects any guy who wants to go out with her plus the fact that she doesn't know the first thing about sex she doesn't know where to start until she meets Kosuda her "Golden Cherry Boy" who she declares she will have sex with first.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
My Thoughts:
When I first started watchingB gata H Kei I watched it knowing I was gonna hate it but need to kill some time and wanted to find out how bad it was. Surprisingly enough I actually started liking the show the more I watched it and found myself wanting to watch the next episode after finishing one. While this show defiantly isn't as good as other romance anime such as Clannad, Yamada and Kosuda are still likable enough that you enjoy seeing them together and want to see their relationship succeed. Also where this show shines is the comedy aspect. At some points I was practically out of breath from laughing so much. Usually sexual comedy really isn't my personal favorite but this show does it so well it is really had not to laugh.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Characters:


Yamada- A young girl who at first glance is a lustful vain narcissist and even at a second glace she is still those things but she has insecurities and realistic emotions as well that is latter fleshed out more.


Kosuda, Takashi- A Sheepish indecisive young man who is about average in about every sense of the word but is the Cherry of Yamada's eye. 


Minharu Takeshita- Yamada's best friend, who is somewhat sarcastic or dry and is usually her voice of reason even though her concerns are usually ignored. 


Kyoka Kanejo- Yamada's rival and the series antagonist, she is obsessed with perfection and her brother Keiichi.


Mayu Miyano- childhood friend of Kosuda and is in love with Kousuda but she can't seem to make Kousuda realize it.


and of course...


Sex God Yamada Cloud Thing- It is like Yamada's imaginary friend but a really sexual imaginary friend who wants to get Yamada laid and has a white mustache and cane because fuck it.


also other side characters include:


Chicka- Yamada's Sister

Kazuki- Kosuda's Sister

Daisuke- Miharu's Boyfriend


Also while on the subject of characters both the Japanese and English dubs are actually pretty good. While I have only finished the entire show in English going back in watching a few in Japanese you really are good going with either.

----------------------------------------------

Animation/Music

Opening/Ending Theme

While I am no expert on Music or Animation just from out of everything I have watched the shows animation and music are quite average. But mind you the Opening has a tune so catchy even though it is in Japanese you will be humming it for weeks and the video sequence is also nice and fits the show well but is nothing to memorable.

The ending is also quite average video is quite average but the song again is catchy as fuck and it to you will not be out of your head anytime soon.

----------------------------------------------------

Overall: 


Overall I actually enjoyed the anime quite a bit but still all characters besides Yamada feel underdeveloped and flat, The story at times seems to drag at points, and the animation/music are over all quite average.

Saying that I defiantly recommend to watch this show if you need something to enjoyably kill some time.

----------------------------------------------------


Story: 7/10

Animation: 6/10

Music: 6/10

Opening/Ending Theme: 8/10

Personal Enjoyment: 8/10

---------------------------------------

Overall: 7/10


Stream It, Don't buy it.

*sigh* B Gata H Kei....You remind me so much of an anime version of Sex in the City...
B Gata H Kei, or Yamada's first time, is about a 15 year old girl named Yamada who was just enrolled in Takizawa High School. She is considered to be beautiful, but there is only one problem. She is TOTALLY concious about her own body and she constantly questions why certain parts of her body looks extremely weird. During her time of becoming a high school student,  she has decided that she wants to have sex with 100 guys by the time she graduates. But there aremore problems: she's still a virgin, she doesn't know anything about seduction or sex, and she hasn't even had her first kiss yet. Throughout the series, she comes across different solutions to perform on fellow classmate, Kosuda Takashi, who is also a virgin. Yamada believes that seducing Kosuda will help her seduce more men in the world.


I liked this anime because there were hilarious moments that made me fall out of  my seat and the fact that Yamada's determination to lose her virginity really made me give her a tiny bit of sympathy for her in hopes that she does lose her virginity. But, her determination also had its flaws as well. As a first impression with this anime, I thought that Yamada looked extremely desperate and annoying, given the fact that she would always tease her best friend and classmate Takeshita and gives Kosuda the nickname "Cherry Boy". I.believe that Kosuda is the type of person who would be considered "pure" before marriage but he would also be open to anything, depending on what the relationship is like. Of course as I progressed through the anime, the relationship between Yamada and Kousda was pretty complicated. Like Facebook complicated. I mean they were technically in a relationship...But they weren't at the same time. Yamada made it seem as if the relationship was just strictly sexual and casual. Nothing else. This relationship included lots of jealously between themselves and people in and outside of school and all the awkwardness in the entire world as they are trying to figure out what they really want from the opposite sex.This sex comedy follows the exact plot of sexual American dramas, with a splash of difficult situations from left to right. I guess you can say that this could also be categorized as a slice of life anime as well.


Overall, I would give this anime a 8/10 because of its complicated relationships between characters and how it quickly resembles Sex in the City (I have only watched one episode of Sex in the City, don't judge me). I would  recommend this anime to anyone who is interested into sexual humor and comedy, and if you're not, you'll probably want to stay away because this anime is a lot to handle, in a cute and sexual way.

The dialogue is good and realistic. It's easy to understand how the characters feel. I really laughed at some of the embarrassing things that were said.
The animation is good but not remarkable.
I wouldn't recommend this right away, only ifthe person who asks doesn't have anything else to watch.\n

Hilarious, indeed.

Ok- first of all this was a laugh out loud series that can be seriously placed under comedy- but if you're looking for something that'll get you into Hentai and Ecchi /slowly/ without over-doing it then this is the perfect anime.
Story-8:Reason: Like with most 12-ep anime (some of my favs) they had a plot and they had to have enough material to fill but not too much to go over and swamp the audience. Luckily this story was easy to follow and in some cases too simple where the ideas just meshed and wind up being comical all the way through. Seperated into two partsfor each episode which would make them mini episodes (like Hetalia) it did span over 2 years within the series. Pretty good for what they were aiming for with the main characters and their struggle. XD They do break 4th-wall a lot of beware.


Art-7:Reason: The art was something to admire but not over-analyze it. To me it had a kind of "glossy" appearance where everything was like plastic. I liked it, and I thought it had a clean look. Background work was detailed, especially for scenes used for nature, houses, paintings, etc. which can be seen in the series(look around hard enough). The characters were "normal" in a sense with the exception of a few pink-haired characters that sparkled. And for the subbed version they do provide censors, so don't think you'll see anything.


Sound-7:Reason: Obvious this anime has a "naughty" feel to it, so the sounds are going to lean towards that- but in a funny way. The main characters get the blunt end of this throughout the entire show. Funny sound effects are added to emphasize certain actions more in this anime than some others, which again makes it more cartoon-ish, even for the "naughty/comedy" bits there are sounds that you'd normally here coming from a circus or in an only cartoon. But that's the point- and it's rather appropriate to lighten the mod and make the audience laugh. The music for the entire show stayed constant. Really cute and adorable- like a musical version/summary of what's happening in the show. I wouldn't say the opening or ending are addictive if you listen for awhile-but they do give you a bubbly-happy feeling, so it's a good pick-me-up.


Characters-7: Reason: OK- first off a lot of characters not too much character development aside from the main two characters. the rest are merely side-cast. Some characters do explain themselves and over all in this anime I suppose it's alright not to have to much going on-it would distract from the main idea. Although this could also be considered a harem at one point- the characters do have their individual ideas and actions as the story progresses. Rivalries appear, hearts broken, and many just seem out to get the other- while all still being funny. And it all makes you just want to push the characters along it gets slightly frustrating with them. But over-all decently entertaining characters and each one fills a typical anime role well if you can spot them.


Enjoyment:10-Reason:It just had me laughing, simple. The anime itself had a straight and obvious plot but the journey to get to that point was just filled with obstacles that might not normally happen in real life (or maybe they do depending on who you are) or just seems like bad luck and misunderstandings ruled over the characters lives. The main heroine Yamada(never figures out her name) is just a bundle of nerves and guts- but not too bright while her leading man Kosuda is just as block-headed...and the Eros deities literally have nothing better to do but explain things and watch from the sidelines with failing attempts on helping out- which again brings it all down to enjoying watching these characters make fools of themselves over something...delicate but not the most complicated thing in the world.


Overall-8:Reason: Fun, entertaining, a good way to experience the "naughty" side to anime but still know where the line is drawn with the comedy. Nothing too out there but something anyone willing to watch should. Re-watching is also an option for laughs.

It's been a while since an anime literally made me laugh out loud repeatedly (ecchi or otherwise). Since I was simultaneously watching Stein's Gate and Kuma Miko (which are both equally brilliantly hilarious), B Gata H Kei had some serious competition when it came to making me laugh and keeping me hooked. 
Luckily, this show never once disappointed me, and, on the contrary, often surprised me. From the unusual and creative premise to the relate-able characters as well as the great voice acting and cute music, this anime had lots of strengths that made it come together perfectly. 
Nevertheless, this show was not without itsweaknesses. Although I personally found the jokes pretty hilarious, some people may find them slightly vulgar or immature, but hey, this is ecchi, so... what did you expect? 


In fact, for an ecchi anime, B Gata H Kei is surprisingly tame and relies more on humor created by jokes, dialogues, and awkward situations rather than endless panty or boob shots. (Fear not, however, as there's some of that too). 


For me, the only real downside to this show was the art. While the characters were pretty generic but decent, the backgrounds were incredibly lazy to the point of being cringe-worthy. This would occasionally kill the "brilliant" vibe this show had going on and install a "cheap" vibe instead, but overall it was bearable. 


Despite its flaws, B Gata H Kei is an excellent show which relies on an entertaining plot and dynamic characters to bring its slightly-perverted humor to life. Whether you're fan of the genre or not, you will probably find yourself laughing in surprise and disbelief at Yamada's unexpectedly awkward sexual adventures.

Looking at the synopsis for this series again, I'm actually wondering the exact same thing. Whatever the reason, I am so glad I watched B Gata H Kei, as it was surprisingly one of the best comedy anime series I saw in 2010.
Brace yourself for the synopsis, because, as I mentioned before, it's pretty crazy. The story centers around Yamada, (first name withheld for whatever reason) a high school girl with the face and body of a model. Apon entering high school, Yamada decides on a crazy goal: to have casual sex with 100 boys. However, being self concious of the fact that she isa virgin, she decides she needs to start by targeting a boy who is a virgin as well. She soon crosses paths with Kosuda, the most generic, uninteresting boy she has ever met, who, unfortunately for him, meets Yamada's criteria perfectly.


When watching the first episode of B Gata H Kei, I had incredibly low expectations just from reading the synopsis. Needless to say, I was dead wrong to assume that this series wouldn't be any good. I found myself cracking up several times, sometimes to the point of tears. What makes this series so hillarious is that, as determined as she is, Yamada has no freaking clue what she's doing. She chickens out of her supposedly "brilliant" plans, and when she actually gets the balls to do something, she has no clue where to go next. Admit it: it is so much fun to watch people screw up.


The characters...well they're all idiots. There are several points in the series where you wonder what kind of moron actually does shit like this. Some of the better supporting characters in the series include Tachibana, Yamada's best girl friend who is often rather annoyed with her one-track mind, and Kajenou, a gorgeous American girl with a severe brother complex. But if you've seen this series, you will probably be surprised with my answer. Her name is Misato. She can't really even be considered a supporting character...more like a background character. She is flat chested, short, and generally unnatractive in the eyes of men...which isn't so good considering she likes to follow hot guys around like a lost puppy and drool all over them like a bulldog. Although she only made about one, short appearence per episode, I had to smile every time she appeared.


Flaws? Oh yeah, very many. First of all, like many animes in the comedy-ecchi genre, it fails when it tries to be dramatic. The more sentemental scenes were just boring, and when you watch them, you want them to skip to the comedy as quickly as possible. Second of all, the characters, although very entertaining, were not very well developed. There are several points in the series where the characters do things that, as far as you know, are completely unlike them. 


The main problem I had with B Gata H Kei was that if you're going to do a series like this, the comedy has to get better with every episode. With this series, the laugh-chart kind of moved in a straight line, and it got a little bit old after a while.


Overall, I am very glad I gave this series a try. Although I would never say it's the best comedy series I've seen, I can say that it is most likely the best ecchi. I was very sad to see this series come to an end, and I still find myself hoping for more.

I bought the blu-ray of B Gata H Kei, without having seen the show. I didn't know what I was getting myself into. B Gata H Kei is a recent 2010 spring anime series based on a 4 koma manga that is currently, to my knowledge, still running. You're basic school romantic comedy with a twist (of course, was isn't these days). It's animated by Hal Film Maker, who also did Skip Beat!, another good romantic comedy. First and foremost, B Gata H Kei is heavily based on sex jokes and not so much physical humor as most romantic comedy's are, along with the fact that it aired at one AM, this is easily not recommendable for girls/women; this is strictly teenagers to old guys. The humor mostlystems from the nympho female lead, Yamada, who's dream is to have 100 sex buddies due to her virgin insecurities. However, she's quick to try and rush the sex part of her relationship with male lead, Takashi Kosuda. But despite her high ambitions, she can't find it in her to go through with the act, devolving from self proclaimed sex maniac, to a normal shy virgin girl. Not helping the situation is Kosuda's own sexual inexperience and nervousness, leading to usually hilarious awkward moments. Usually.


Story: The entire story is told literally in the first five minutes; Yamada wants sex. Her pride keeps her from jumping anyone more experienced with her, so she "chooses" Kosuda. From episodes one to twelve, it remains entirely episodic, with usually a small string of plot keeping the episodes connected. Characters are introduced at a good steady pace with an obvious and huge focus on Yamada. Anybody who watches B Gata H Kei will either love Yamada, or hate her, depending on how you think about it. On the outside, she's just a sex maniac, which alone is enough to get on some people's nerves, who can't go through with actually have sex with a guy, even though when you're the school idol anyone will have sex with you. At first i thought this was funny, then i got really tired of it, until i thought about it differently. She's clearly a parody of "horny" girls who try to grow up too fast. While I may be reading into this too much, you'll see that she goes to great lengths to know sex, yet refuses to try it. Clearly no girl is as crazy for sex as she is, and her straight faced friend, Takeshita Miharu, even points out that she makes no sense. Even Kosuda is a parody; he's portrayed as a boring individual, and it definitely shows as in most of his scenes his name is either forgotten or he's ignored outright. There is the classic childhood friend unrequited love, which everybody is so dense about it's almost pitiful. Even the cliche perfect study abroad girl who returns to Japan is "perfect", she definitely wants to keep the apples falling as close to the tree as possible (you'll see). Don't take the story or characters seriously, it's a light hearted sex comedy that doesn't treat sex like taboo, but this may be the only thing that makes it funny. Watch the first episode and decide, as i can't tell if the humor came from the shock value of a crazy horny girl, or if it was legitimately funny.


One complaint is the last two episodes, where it ultimately devolves into a borderline hentai video. Nothing is shown, but it quickly goes from funny perverted show, to censored porn. Again, don't take it seriously though, it's a more realistic view of what virgins think when they first have sex. The conclusion is also meh, but above average. It gives a clear conclusion for most characters, and ends nicely, but abruptly. It ends in a way that won't have a sequel, but you know it still goes on in the B Gata H Kei world.


Asthetics: The art is simple and nice, but nothing amazing. Character designs aren't interesting, which is a shame since there aren't too many characters that get the spotlight. Clothes; however, are rather nice. While most school life animes have nothing but uniforms, you'll see a nice variety of dresses and suits, but if you're a guy you probably don't care and most people watching this will be guys. Opening is poppy and energetic, while the ending isn't anything special, music isn't used too much during the show either. 


I know B Gata H Kei got a lot of bad rep (threatening letters) but it's a good show if it's a satire, bad show if it's a straight romantic comedy. In the end, don't take it seriously and don't go looking for amazing plots. Girls should stay away if looking for romantic comedies, but any girl looking to laugh at themselves or have a good sense of dirty humor are welcome.

The series starts of very quirky and hilarious. It uncovers the truth that unlike the given stereotype teenage girls too can be irrational, curious and horny. And i found myself privately giggling at similar experiences I had when I was first introduced to vulgarity, sexuality and well to be blunt sex. 
The series starts with many funny moments  and very amusing likeable characters. However I found the plot began to fall short as the characters and story developed into the conventional high school anime drama/plot.
 I dont know, I liked its individuality for being completely vulgar but alas the characters took the sensible road.\n\n
Great at the beginning! but if you find yourself bored by the middle the ending wont make up for the lul.

There is only one way to describe the main character of this anime, nympho-maniac. That being said, this is a really hilarious anime that I enjoyed far more than I thought I would. First, one might see this as cliche, Boy meets girl, they both fall in love with each other and blah blah blah. Those animes are always good and I am a fan of that kind of thing but this was very original. Our main character Yamada is crazy about sex, and would be considered overly perverted even if she was a boy despite holding her "V card" as they put it inthe translation. All she wants is be become experience with another virgin before she accomplishes her goal of giving it up to 100 guys. She mercilessly tries to use Kosuda at first, but unbeknownst to both of them they start to like each other as in most animes. The transformation/evolution of their feelings is very rewarding to watch.\n
Now that I told you about the romance part, Ill tell you about the comedy. I personally watched the dubbed version of this series and I believe that it added something due to some ludicrous translations. The animation of some of the scenes also added to the comedy. Now, the part that added the most to the comedic nature of this anime was the story itself, in anime usually only a guy is perverted, but Yamada is so sex crazed yet so inept its hilarious. I thought it was a great change of pace.\n
After those two main aspects of the story the character development was excellent as well as their design. So I highly recommend this to anyone who enjoyed Rosario and Vampire, Nagizaka Haruka no Himitsu, Chobits, or Itazura Na Kiss.

Have you ever really wanted to get laid really bad? I mean reeaaally bad? Have you ever not been aware that a girl was into you until she flat out states it?
If the answer is yes, maybe B Gata H Kei  feel familiar to you.
Story: 6/10
The story of B Gata H Kei is; Yamada, a high school girl wants to make one hundred sex friends, but because of her lack of experience she has to start small with the cherry boy Takeshi Kosuda. As there relationship grows comedy ensues as all they want to do is get to know each other a little andbang like rabbits. 


Art: 7/10

For a show like this it has surprisingly nice artwork. The coloring is bright. The animation while a little stiff looks presentable. Backgrounds are typical but not bad in any stretch of the imagination. Character design, while very plain feels comforting.


Sound: 6/10

There isn't much to say about the soundtrack. It suits the role of background music. Voice acting is also very nice.


Character: 7.5/10

Here is where the show gets good. The characters are really fun. The sex crazed Yamada is a very fun character who shows some good comic relief, while having some very cute moments of her own. Kosuda is also someone who can be funny at times as you see the spaghetti fall out of his pockets from episode to episode. Side characters like Takeshita (best girl), Miyano, and Kyouko all provide good side content and gets you better invested in the characters lives.


Enjoyment: 8/10

This is a fun show. It's innocent and cute enough. If your down or just bored give this show a watch. It's not the worst show out there nor is it the best but, if you're like me you'll have a good time.

Here with my third review, this time for 'B Gata H Kei', and can I just say, If your reading this review than you will probably never get laid..............ANYWAY!!
If you are an ecchi, romance, comedy lover. Than look no further. This show will be in your top ten in no time
For me, I'm not the biggest fan of ecchi. So I was really hesitant to watch this anime. I mean, the premise of a girl wanting to have sex with 100 guys!! Come on!! However I can say I did not regret watching this show at all!!
The reason why I like this show so muchis not for it's characters, not for it's plot (perviest plot ever XD), not for it's art, no none of that stuff. The reason why I like this show so much is the same reason why I love Toradora so much, and that is the relationship between the two main characters Kosuda and Yamada.


This relationship that they have is the only one that has ever topped Ryuuji and Taiga for me. The way the story progresses, and how Yamada's feelings for Kosuda start to develop further than him being her sex toy. As cliché as it sounds, I liked it a lot.


(Spoiler here, you've been warned)

Also the point where Yamada pulls her hand away from Keiichi when he tried to kiss it, I was all Like Ohhhhhhhh dang, You just got shot down man!! It was totally unexpected, and not to mention my favorite part in the whole show. So even though it is cliché, it has some things that will really surprise you.


Story (8) I'm giving the story an 8, because though it is extremely perverted and just weird. It is also unique in it's own way. I can't think of another show who has done anything like this, can you? Even though she never actually does have sex with 100 guys, but not like that wasn't already obvious.


Characters (9) I really like a lot of the side characters. The only problem was we didn't get to learn about a lot of them like Daisuke, Miharu, Kazuki etc. But what are you gonna do in a 12 episode show. You wouldn't have time for the main premise if you focused to much on backgrounds, so I can see why it lacked for most part.


Art (8) As I've said before, the way I see it there are four kinds of anime art. There is simple and cute, simple and ugly, complex and beautiful, complex and overdone. Most anime fall under the simple and cute one, along with this anime. I really liked the art in the show, but for being a 2010 made I was expecting a little bit better. Though I can't complain, I have seen worse


Sound (8) Like I have also said before, I've never known how to really judge sound. I guess I should judge it, for this anime, being the emotion that was felt. Most of the time, the emotional parts in this show would be more awkward than anything. There wasn't really any moment that pulled on my heartstrings, but none the less I really liked it.


I can also judge the voice acting for sound as well. I watched the english dubbed version so...don't hate me. I really loved all of the voice actors. Brittney Karbowski is one of my favorite voice actresses, and I think she pulls off Yamada amazingly. I do really like Scott Freeman's voice, but being Kosuda I liked his voice even more. He really pulls off Kosuda well. Cherami Leigh to with Miharu, I really liked it


Enjoyment (10) For some reason, I'm not sure why, B Gata H Kei is one of those shows that I can watch over and over and never get bored. The only other show that has done that for me has been...of course...Toradora. I don't what it is about it, but It's humor and unexpected events along with a beautiful growing romance between two unlikely people just get me going every time. So If you are anything like me than you will love this show a lot.


Overall (9) I am giving this show a 9 because, though it's relationship was the best that I've ever seen (In my opinion) the other things that it lacked brings the score down. But evidently not much because a 9 is still really good. So what are you waiting for? Quit reading this boring review and go watch the show already!!

Okay, first off, I'll be honest, I was in the mood for some low-brow sexy comedy when I found this one. And, I can't imagine that most people would find it as enjoyable as I did, but then again, I'm basically Yamada in male form. But I'm not just talking about the sex obsession, I'm talking about overthinking. That was the thing that really got to me about this show.
Have you ever had a friend who needs to think things through, who never has a plan but also isn't spontaneous? Who isn't shy but is reserved? Yamada is such a wonderful character who is poorlyrepresented in the world of entertainment. A character who lives in her own head, concocting fantasies, scheming, creating plans that all fall awry because one thing doesn't go her way. Confident of her goals but terrified of failure to meet them. There are so many people that can relate to this character, and I'm definitely one of them.


It's also refreshing to see a very accurate depiction of attitude in a highschool setting in an anime, at least as a westerner. A lot of anime that I've watched tends to make everyone embarrassed of relationships, sex, romance, attraction, while this show aims to show more how people can be one way and act another. That whole feeling of, "If Yamada was honest with herself, she could have her cake and eat it too, but she's so obsessed with being this thing she isn't, that she never gets laid". Well, how many people can you name that were like that, especially in highschool. People put on one face and feel a completely different way.


Anyways, if you're a prude or feel like this isn't appropriate for kids, guess what, it's not for kids. It's cathartic to those of us living in our own heads, it's reminiscent of HS and all it's funny quirks in a frighteningly accurate way, and it's pretty spot-on as to what hormones are did to us at that age, what they do to kids today, and what they will do to the kids we all end up having.

They think they are ready, but just aren't. When push comes to shove she shrinks away realizing what she wants to happen kinda scare her unless she find a guy she is comfortable with.
