Yes she is the most attractive girl in school, but is also a bully. (yes, it's only because she's nervous/excentric, but I don't see much ofa silver lining.) I wasn't rooting for them to be together at all. \n\n
The anime starts as a quest to sleep with 100 boys, and turns into a realistic romance. This anime deals with themes that are more realistic to high school students, and not the cliche anime themes of "i accidentally grabbed your boobs, we kissed, now we are a couple." This paired along with the comedy, this anime had a lot of potential. Too bad I wanted to punch every one of the characters in the face.

So I had to watch this anime when my parent was asleep because of the nature of it. I liked the art in it but the main character in it was, how do I say? Over outgoing for her goal, which is to expect from most anime. (The main character making a goal and attempting to complete it) The last episode did come as a shock but as I watched this anime I got the "Called it" feeling because during me watching it, I pretty much expected the ending to turn out the way it did.

This anime is a lot more than what it seems to be at first glance. When you read the plot synopsis you might think it's full-on hentai, but it's actually nowhere near that. 
It's a teenage romance comedy sprinkled with some ecchi throughout, and as the plot kept on progressing, I focused way more on the romantic/comedic parts rather than the ecchi parts. 
I personally really enjoyed it because I could really relate to the main character. I was exactly the same as her when I was 15. Hormonal, lustful, thoughts going wild everyday... but completely awkward and clueless as to how to go aboutmy desires and how to express them. Also, I thought it was really refreshing to see a sex-obsessed female lead character. There's plenty of ecchi anime out there with sleazy male protagonists - seeing things from a female perspective is definitely a nice change, especially since it's so spot on (the author of the manga is female, if I'm not mistaken, so it definitely makes sense). \n\n
Anyway, don't let the plot synopsis drag you away from this anime - it's nowhere near as dirty as it sounds. Even though Yamada (the main protagonist) says she wants to eventually have 100 sexual partners, it's as clear as day she's not ready for it nor does she know how the hell to go about it. At the end of the day it's a really cute romantic comedy revolving around two inexperienced teenagers discovering themselves and coming to terms with their sexuality. It definitely had me reminiscing about my own past and realizing both me and my male interests at that time were exactly the way Yamada and Kosuda are portrayed - awkward, nervous, thoughts and fantasies running rampant, not knowing what the other thinks, being too afraid to ask, messing up... It's all part of growing up. And our two protagonists do it so well together. ♥ I really enjoyed the story, it's 10/10 for me.

Be warned: this show is an advertisement for the manga. If you were hoping for a story with a conclusion, please look elsewhere.
I never really watch ecchi-type shows. Not out of some lofty, anachronistic disgust at a show with sexual themes, but more because they rarely offer anything interesting in terms of story and character. In many ways, this series followed that trend, but also surpassed my expectations in certain ways. I was pleasantly surprised at the lack of blatant fanservice. I usually start rolling my eyes and losing interest in shows that incessantly look for excuses to do panty shots, accidental gropes, walk-ins etc.,so it was a nice change of pace to see a show that uses sex only when it seems important to the character and story development. Until the last episode. Hooooooly fuck the last episode. What an absolute trainwreck. No spoilers, but it was honestly one of the most bafflingly idiotic fanservice romps I've ever seen. It was nothing but a series of absurdly contrived non-sequiturs to rip through as many pointless fanservice moments as possible. All I can think is that it must have been contractually obligated by the publishers. Otherwise, I see no reason why the creators of the show would have produced something so unforgivably stupid. A mentally handicapped child could have easily written a satisfying ending to this show, and instead we got something that played like the transcribed ramblings of a sex addict on bath salts. 


*deep breath*


Anyway, the main characters were at least relatable enough to be interesting. I can easily see myself acting very similarly in high school, and to be honest, I found Yamada and Kosuda's starting point to be a fairly insightful depiction of a young adult's sexual awakening. Filled with hormones and obsessed with sex but too timid and inexperienced to actually get anything done. I just wish they had developed, like at all. The show seems to go out of its way to avoid interactions between the two romantic leads and I found myself wondering if they had ever actually had a casual conversation. From a story structure perspective, of course the two leads are going to end up together, but the show never really gives us a reason why. The supporting cast was pretty bare-bones and mostly there for comic relief, which they accomplish for the most part. The recurring "sex-gods" gag was probably my favorite part of the show and got a few actual out-loud laughs from me. 


I don't have much to say about the story. As far as rom-coms go, it felt pretty formulaic, but formulas exist for a reason. If it works, it works. It doesn't get points for doing anything particularly new or interesting, but it keeps the train on the rails long enough to deliver some good comedy. Then the last episode happened, and you already know how I feel about that. 


The art was never amazing, but it wasn't glaringly bad either. I generally only take artwork into my evaluation when it fits one of these two categories. However, whoever decided to give the Kanejou siblings those obnoxious perpetual sparkles has a special place waiting for them in hell. 


I listened to the OP and ED once each and decided to spare my ears that experience for the rest of my viewing. The voice acting was very trope-centric and every stereotype had a fitting voice. I did find myself questioning the choice for Yamada's voice. I couldn't help but think the voice sounded way to young for someone who was supposedly a post-pubescent high school Junior. 


Overall, I can't honestly recommend this show. If it had ended satisfactorily, I may have considered it, but the final episode gave me actual for-realsies PTSD and I would never wish that on anyone.

Well, what can I say about B Gata H kei? 
I don`t watch much ecchi anime but this one surely deserves a watch. 
I ended up enjoying this way more than I though I would. 
It felt so strange but yet I could`t stop watching (I was not famillier with ecchi at the time I saw this anime) 
Story (8) 
Well... the story is simple but well developed in what could had been developed.At least in the ecchi padron. It`s not to be taken too serious. What this anime has as a special talent is the humour! 
I found the humour of this anime verygood, I actually loled a few times and I`m quite hard to please. 

But I think that sometimes it went overboard, like when Keiichi arrived from the airport, it was excessive the "princess and the handkiss" scene.

Sound (6)

It is the ultimate romantic comedy. Emphasis on Comedy. This is one of the few, no, one of two rom-com anime that truly made me laugh out loud. And not the "LOL" typed laughs, but actual laughter that makes sound. In terms of comedy it is true gold. sex jokes galore and cluelessness abound in this journey to adulthood for these two lovers. comedy wise, it is a laugh and a half. but thats only half of the anime. the other half, the romance of it, was also very good, including some unexpected developments for a rom-com/ecchi type anime. the complications are simple, the story is also simple, but the romance is genuine, and the comedy is top notch.


Art:8

Its an older anime, so don't expect too much from it. With that said, art wise its still very good. The style is a little older, and the animation might not be able to stand with some of the newer stuff, but it does the job well, it isn't choppy or jerky, and overall it is just well produced, very consistent in quality. Yamada is cute as heck too. especially in the opening song. Also, shoutout to the artist who included ONE SINGLE UNCENSORED NIPPLE IN THE LAST EPISODE. waiting for that was totally worth it 


Sound:8

very well chosen VAs. lets just put that out right now. there are a few VAs that i really like, and the ones chosen for this anime were very fitting. but other than that, the sound was pretty generic, nothing especially ear-catching. Similar to the art style, its consistent, not many cock ups. 


Character: 9

in a very surprising fashion for an ecchi anime. there is actually a single defining, and very serious point of development in this anime. and that point is Yamada. Yamada actually goes from becoming a frustrated virgin into a respectable lover. from wanting "100 sex buddies" to only wanting kosuda (the other dude). Kosuda also goes through minor development, overcoming his fears of being completely average (of which he is). Other than those two the other minor characters are all entirely run-of-the-mill archetypes. Theres the loli, the experienced friend, the childhood friend, the oni-con and her hot onii-san, the hot teacher etc etc. an all of these are entirely archetypical and single-faceted. Though every one of them is still very well written from  comedic standpoint.


Enjoyment: 10

if you can't tell already, I enjoyed this anime immensely. its lighthearted, very comedic, decently romantic, and very enjoyable. and thats where the true value of this anime is. its very enjoyable, very funny, and worth watching if you have some time for a short series. 


OVERALL:10

So maybe you've read this whole thing and you're now thinking, "this dude is an idiot! mathematically it doesn't work, and this dude is just an idiot ecchi lover". Which is actually true on all accounts. It doesn't work out mathematically. it just is a 10 anime in my eyes. even though the character is a bit lacking, the sound generic, and the art just decently consistent, the story really makes up for it, and really makes it enjoyable. the story is entirely worth watching it, especially for the comedy. the comedy cant be quantified. its amazingly good. and who doesn't like sex jokes?? if i had to compare it to something it would probably be a romantic version of shimoneta (which is also a great rom-com that emphasizes the comedy A LOT). but mathematically (for the haterz) it would be 3 for story+3 for comedy + 2 for characters + 1 for ecchi + 1 for being nearly softcore porn =10 hahaha (insert "dey see me rollin', dey hatin' " verse right here). 


So yea a 10 for comedy gold, ecchi, and a great story tying it all together. Peace.

So immediately the first thing that stands out is the premise. 
This anime is about Yamada, a gorgeous, popular and smart high school girl who is on a quest to bang 100 random guys before graduation. Holy shit! The room is spinning! Calm down. Take a deep breath. Keep reading. It’s not a hentai and she's actually a virgin who has never even been kissed. But let’s pause here for a second. This is about a hot chick looking for sex. Process that. Why would this ever take more than 5 minutes to accomplish? What’s her difficulty finding a mate? Well, she’s very self-conscious abouther lady parts and her lack of experience. Her "brilliant" solution is to have casual sex with a shy, nerdy classmate named Kosuda to prepare herself for the impending conga line of other dudes. Will she fall for Kosuda or will he just be one of her many sexual conquests? BGHK is a parody of the stereotypical high school romance genre and is filled with sexual mishaps, close calls, and ridiculous humor in the setting of surprisingly genuine character development from both parties.


In addition to a lot of hilarious and dirty dialogue/monologue, I think this anime has heart and a very fascinating dynamic between the mains. The strength of the anime is Kosuda and Yamada’s weird relationship which (initially) revolves around one issue--sex. Paradoxically, sex is their relationship’s worst enemy and greatest ally. The faster Yamada and Kosuda rush into bed (as Yamada originally planned), the less likely their relationship will last. Kosuda will have been handed sex without learning anything about being a man, while Yamada will have slept with Kosuda without bonding with him enough to abandon her slutty ambitions. At the same time, without their mutual sex drives blazing they would have no impetus to interact, talk or to get to know each other. It’s a strange balance. Summed up, it’s a story of Yamada’s internal struggle to decide whether she is capable of having either ‘sex without love’ or ‘love without sex’.


 Art: The art was very average. This became a problem with their depiction of Yamada. Yamada is supposed to be the hottest girl in school, basically a goddess amongst mortals. This is more than just a minor point as Yamada’s beauty and Kosuda’s plainness are integral to the premise. In truth I didn’t think the animation was sharp enough to really let me appreciate the supposed huge gap between Yamada and Kosuda, or Yamada vs other girls. Don’t get me wrong, the animation was fine but it requires you to use your imagination. 


Sound: I loved the “Kiss me baby” theme. Holy shit, it’s the girliest song I’ve ever heard but it’s so god damn catchy. I’m about to deadlift in the gym and god help me if the bar suddenly rips the earbuds from my MP3 player and it switches to speaker. Let’s hope nobody finds out. The English Dubs are actually pretty good too. 


Characters:

Yamada: At least initially, she is a really horrible person. I won’t deduct points for that because I think it makes her more interesting. She is vain, shallow, manipulative, jealous and selfish. 

On top of that, she has a complete lack of modesty or inhibition. It’s hilarious. I did find it a little creepy how there was no reason for why she was so emotionally frigid. But at the end of the day, it’s ok to have no explanation, and BGHK still works. Earlier I said it’s a parody of the romance genre. If other animes can feature hot, popular, wholesome girls who never even considered having a boyfriend before the wimpy main character showed up, then BGHK can have the no less believable nympho Yamada. 


Kosuda is your average, unimpressive loser. He’s a stock character. Basically a blank slate. 


The other characters, in one way or another, serve as a massive support network for Yamada/Kosuda. They serve as pushing/pulling forces that guide Yamada/Kosuda to their journey. They are necessary for the plot but certainly not memorable as individual characters.


Overall: This anime ends about halfway into the Manga series. From what I gather, fans were hopeful that there would be a second season but that never happened. The BGHK anime ends on kind of a weak note. If you want to find out what happens to the characters I recommend the manga. The manga artwork is pretty bad but the story is hilarious and delightful. The manga is a lot dirtier (and funnier) than the anime series. Apparently in the manga Yamada is a compulsive masturbator. Who knew?

I can't stand ecchi, but I decided to give this a go because it apparently didn't fall into the frustrating plot moves ecchi normally does. It was a mistake and frankly, it has convinced me to never watch ecchi again.
The series is hilarious but falls into the many, many pitfalls of ecchi story telling. Expect to suffer many cardiac arrests from the down-right ridiculous obstacles they throw in the way of story progression, down to the last minute. If you're looking for a short fun series, I don't recommend it. It has absolutely no closure, with no sequel visible (even though it is strongly hinted).I have never felt so at war with myself when talking about B Gata H Kei. It has given me some of the best laughs, second to Nichijou, and it is a very interesting premise. 


*POSSIBLE SPOILERS FROM NOW ON**


However, I absolutely cannot forgive the ending, it is what you're all expecting from it just from the ecchi tag, but it is far worse at the same time. It leads you on into false hope and snatches away what you've been watching the series for right in front of your eyes, over and over again. They throw up the typical road blocks that prevent what the fans want from happening WAY more than they should have, just to milk a second season. The series would have been a 9 had it ended the way it was pretending it would, but it didn't. This has left the most bitter taste in my mouth and I don't think I can ever forgive it for that.

Hm, I'm still looking for the reason why I watched this show. I always like anime with deep stories, psychological themes, mysteries or horror, and after that I watch some romantic tragedies that makes me bawl my eyes out. So when I read the synopsis for this anime, I didn't know why but something in my head went (YAS TAKE A BREAK FROM YOUR USUAL THING AND WATCH IT). And I followed that voice in my head that always get me in trouble and watched it.
STORY:
Basically Yamada is a 15 yo highschooler, the prettiest in her highschool, gets good grades, popular, but there's one thingshe dislikes about herself : being a virgin. So her goal in this show is to get 100 sex buddies. 

You may think that the show will be filled with sex scenes or stuff, but I think the producers had one of those (HA! SURPRISE BITCH) moments and turned the show to something else.... a cute romance comedy. Here we meet Kosuda, the average clueless virgin shy guy, that is the first -and mind you,the last- target of Yamada. The show unfold their story as they struggle to find ... love? Sex? Lust ? One may never know.


CHARACTERS:

To be really honest with you, I hated Yamada. Yes, sometimes I agreed with her and especially when she said (Love is supposed to make you happy, then why am I feeling this ...) but other than this line, she honestly can go and........ herself. She is stuck up, arrogant and sometimes annoying. Yeah, she may be nice at times but it's so rare. She didn't deserve Kosuda.

Kosuda is your typical shy nice guy. He is in the photography club so he always has his camera with him. He doesn't understand girls at all and sometimes it is so funny.

My favourite characters to be honest are the Sex Gods. They're what makes the show funny for the most part.

Other characters are Yamada's bff, that knows her motives, another violet haired girl that wanna be the school's queen, and the boys' squad that always talks about porn and girls.


OVERALL:

I can't lie, at times I enjoyed the show but what bugged me are the 'GOSH NO ! NOT AGAIN' moments that were so predictable. 

If you want to watch something cute, a bit funny just for the sake of pure enjoyment and because you have plenty of free time and nothing to do, then I recommend this. 

But if, like me, you want to watch something thats gonna open your eyes or that you're gonna remember for the next two years, then this is not for you unless you were bored.


THANKS FOR READING 💋

It's a great anime to watch is you are new to the romance genre, and it's absolutely hilarious. Made me laugh like crazy at times. The ecchi is present, but it's not crazy. I must say that the last episodes are great gift from the anime makers as it has a lot of ecchi, giving the anime a nice ending. 
It's not the greatest of school romance or ecchi genre, but it has a great amount of humor, so I would highly recommended.  
What really makes this anime different from other is that the girl, Yamada, is trying to seduce her first victim toget laid. Get it, victim? But Yamada fails most of the time making it so funny. It's clearly one of the few anime were the girls is the one to just to bed openly, and I am not comparing to hentai. \n\n

I really enjoyed watching this anime, it was pretty good in my opinion. 
If you're into Ecchi animes, you need to watch this! It has a pretty good combination between ecchi, romance and comedy and that's the reason because I think this anime is one of the best I've ever seen.
It has its sad moments too in some points of the anime.
History: 
"Yamada, first name withheld, is a 15-year-old girl who has just entered Takizawa High School. Easily considered exceptionally beautiful, she has only one problem with her own body, she thinks her vagina looks weird and is very self-conscious about it. 
Upon entering highschool, her dream was to have casual sex with 100 men but therein lies the problem, she believes an experienced partner will tease her about the way her vagina looks or simply the fact that she's a virgin. She stumbles upon the solution in the form of Kosuda Takashi, a fellow virgin, whom she believes will help ease the transition to more experienced partners.\n\n
There's only one small problem, Yamada doesn't know anything about sex or the ancient art of seduction, meaning her quest to conquer Kosuda will be a difficult one."

Art and Sound: Totally fine
Story: The story is where the show shines. While many other high school themed animes are tame and almost sappy, this one pulls no punches. It does not condescend to its audience nor does it censor the jokes. It is raunchy and really funny. The story does a good job of drawing you in. Why is it not a ten? The story’s problem comes from it belonging to two very different genres. In the ecchi genre the characters remain very static. The entertainment comes from putting these characters is bizarre situations. The problem arises when B Gata H Kei tries toalso be a “coming of age story” in which character growth is necessary. Trying to make the characters unchanging (ecchi style) but also grow as people puts them in a limbo where they end up doing both in an unsatisfying manner. With this comes a mediocre ending. This multiple genre problem leads into….\n
Characters: In a strictly ecchi setting these characters would be very entertaining. The problem arises when the story tries to give them the depth that is necessary for romance. They become a weird hybrid of shallow character tropes and three dimensional characters. This combination makes all the characters really unlikeable. It also makes the romance seem forced and fake.\n
If you are looking for a funny and entertaining anime you won’t be disappointed. If you want romance or anything deep you will be left hanging. \n

This has been a very refreshing anime. Not your run of the mill ecchi show. Lots of naughty thoughts, but never showing any.
The story alone is quite new to me because who would ever think up a story about a girl who wants to have 100 "f*ck*  buddies?
I enjoyed seeing this anime, because the ending always comes to soon and you want to watch more. Will she do it?
Anyway, if you like ecchi shows that are not overly in your face, then this is a must see for you! The art is very pleasant to the eyes too.

After watching the first few episodes I wasn't holding out a lot of hope for this series, but it got better! 
The series is about Yamada-chan, a high school girl who wants to sexually conquer 100 guys while in high school, but who is still a virgin.  She plots to date her first lover but quickly discovers she's very much a novice and quite inexperienced in everything related to guys and dating.  Later she meets a rival that challenges her for favorite girl on campus.
I can't speak for the original dialog but the English subtitled version I watched, was fairly crude (sorry Idid not note which translation team did it!). They tried for American street slang, in particular for sexual topics but it didn't really fit the characters or the series. 


The characters are likable after several episodes (not so much at first). Because they are all decent teenagers the chosen translations didn't fit because they were phrases used by juvenile delinquents.  Still, the story contained a lot of sexual innuendo.  Hard PG rating for sure.


The story turns into a real love story towards the end, which is well done -- and in fact touching -- and elevates my overall rating to 7/10.

Pretty tasteless ecchi anime but it was amusing and I could relate to it in some ways. When I was around 14/15 I felt very pressured into having sex and for a while all I really cared about was sex, anime and video games. About a year or two after I did it I felt "wow i rushed that, didn't I?".  
It's a bit unfortunate that Yamada never really seemed to grasp that she was tactless and had... well, no interests aside from sex. Kosuda literally had no reason to like her, aside from her being really attractive, because they had literally no commoninterests and she pretty much knew nothing about him. Regardless, still a funny show, even for a ecchi comedy though I expected better character development though.

8.5/10
I'm aware that many of you will have simply read B gata H Kei's synopsis and instantly written it off as just another mindless ecchi show with nothing to offer. Admittedly I did the same when i downloaded the first episode. Soon though it became clear that things were really going to be quite different, this isn't a raunchy attempt at fanservice (ie ikkitousen) behind all of the comedic antics theres actually an innocent romance, and to think they managed to keep that romance alive despite the nature of show is actually quite a feat in itself.So we begin with Kosuda your average high schooler, why he's just about as average as they come and Yamada san the crazy female lead who just happens to be on heat 24/7, Along the way other characters are introduced such as Kanejou san the stereotypically rich/flawless challenger to the female lead members of Kosudas family and other people at school also add to the atmosphere of the show.\n
             Why did i give this show an 8? No matter how generic it seems I actually liked the way it was written and how everything came together at the end, check the first couple of eps out , If you don't like them you probably won't like the rest, but for me this is one of the best shows in an all but dismal season of anime.

B Gata H Kei is a romantic/school/comedy that on the surface seems like a typical seinen-esque ecchi-filled anime, but B Gata H Kei actually breaks this mold fairly well.
STORY 7/10
The story takes a bit to start up, but it actually becomes really enjoyable not too far into it. For an anime that's focused around a high-school girl's desire to have sex, it's somewhat tame for the genre, mind you some fan-service is still thrown in. Instead it explores youth, relationships, and emotions. As the story progresses, it gets all the better as characters develop and new twists happen.
ART 6/10
The art is nothing too spectacular. Thenagain, it isn't bad either. It's suiting and quirky.


SOUND 5/10 

One thing to note is that the sound was rather 'eh' in B Gata H Kei. The opening and closing numbers are both long and drab, the voice acting is generally good, but occasionally questionable. Other sound effects and music tracks are often repeated.


CHARACTER 7/10

B Gata H Kei does a really good job with the characters in it. The main characters actually are dynamic and show progression, unlike most animes of its genre. In it we watch Yamada, the main female protagnist, develop as she begins to learn more about 'love' after her pursuits to have sex. We watch the main antagonist (who to prevent spoilers, won't be given away) bring her own downfall. Overall, for its genre, it really accells here.


ENJOYMENT 7/10

While I'm not a normal viewer of the genre, B Gata H Kei stands out and proves itself to be a rather solid anime. With only 12 episodes, it's an easy and quick watch that all turns out fairly enjoyable. It's not something that I'd want to watch again, or something I'd talk about often, but definitley something that I enjoyed watching.


OVERALL 7/10







SIDE NOTES (SPOILER WARNINGS):

There is one thing in this that caught my attention and I'm sure it has caused quite a controversy in it as it really sits in a 'gray' area. The characters' ages are around 15-17. As expected in an ecchi-based anime, especially one that's about a girl trying to lose her virginity, there is a lot of nudity-scenes, and while there is some fanservice, a lot of it is plot-oriented and usually censored and often humorized.

That being said, it was really strange towards the end that they showed Yamada's breasts uncensored. While the anime implies time has past and they may be older, she is still underaged, and even in an anime about teenagers and pressure on teenagers with relationships and virginity, it still bothers me to some extent to see uncensored and underaged in the anime.

STORY/CHARACTERS:
So there's this girl that wishes to have sex with 100 guys. But she's subconscious of her "lady parts" and has trouble getting passed guy #1. By the end Yamada changes a bit and the show becomes a little more serious. This anime has a lot of funny moments but can be serious in some parts that make you relate to the characters. This isn't your average Fan Service Ecchi. It's a romantic comedy first and the characters are great. The relationships between Yamada, Kosuda, and Tekashita are the best in the series. The only bad part of this anime is the last episode. It'ssplit into three sections and tends to drift too far away from the manga. 


ART:

Looks spectacular, the animations are clean and colors are sharp. Backgrounds can seem a little grainy at some parts but it's not much of a bother. 


SOUND:

Get ready for a lot of music, and I mean a lot. There's almost always some kind of background music playing.  Although the constant music can get annoying it matches the mood perfectly each time. Funimations dubbing was spectacular which is why I gave this such a high score. Yamada's voice was the best and it matches her character.


ENJOYMENT:

This anime's pace never gets dull, there's rarely any build up between the jokes and you'll be laughing through it. 


Overall, I liked this anime despite the fact I'm not really a fan of ecchi's but this one is different; it's funny, entertaining to watch, and it lacks fan-service panty-shots....until the last few episodes.  I would definitely recommend this anime and it's associated manga to anyone interested in ecchi.

8/10. 
I myself LOVE ecchi, so thats why I decided to watch this. B Gata H Kei was kinda disappointing  , but worth the watch. They had to censor EVERYTHING, which is a little extreme IMO. Usually ecchi's don't censor the tits and all that, but this one does...But the massive amount of laughs and comedy makes up for it somewhat. I found myself chuckling in about every episode. I would consider B Gata H Kei more of a comedy than a Ecchi.

This is one of amazing Ecchi story that you all must watch my friend. The story is astounding humourous about women who want to make H with 100 males!!!Hah, but you know she never-ever had experience about it nor knowledge about H-scene hahahaha. Its about a same if you are wanna take bath but doesnt know that shower need a water. Absurd! but funny!!!.. :D
Both the main male & female character have a difference personality that makes you want kill one of them, hah! i want kill that man but i do love to seduce that Yamada hahaha...
#Eheeeeem... anyway lets get back on track. Soanyway The overall scene & rating is good, ABSOLUTEEEEEELY GOOD :D\n\n
Dont forget to watch it guys, AAAAAABBBSSSSSSSOOOOOOOOOOOOOOLUUUUUUUUUUUUUTEEEEEEEEEELYYYYYYYYYY RECOMENDED for Ecchi fans  :D

When I first read the synopsis of this anime me and my friend thought it was a joke and so would be a fan serviced filled anime with mindless amounts of ecchi scenes, personally I am not a big fan of ecchi anime being more of a shojo/josei anime viewer myself. Anyway I decided to watch this anime as a joke, just to see how bad it really was but to my surprise it was very entertaining to watch (Because it was really funny ) despite the story being average at best and the music completely unmemorable. This anime is usually either a hit andmiss, but for a less mature audience it is probably going to be a very very entertaining watch.


Story: 6

At first the synopsis may put you off completely from watching B Gata H Kei, after all it does seem completely absurd (as the character wants to have sex with 100 men ._.)  and so it may be dismissed as something only an ecchi enthusiast would watch. In terms of story, the story is quite simple and at times cliche and downright banal. Pretty much it is about Yamada (the main character) trying to have sex with the male lead Kosuda and how she goes about trying to achieve it, it is unique in the sense that it is told from the perspective of a girl (who is planning on being promiscuous and has sexual thoughts running through her mind all the time). Nevertheless the story fails in some respects as it tends to be cliche due to the fact they are constantly interrupted just as they are about to kiss etc etc and that both leads are indecisive which can be frustrating to some viewers, but this is made up for due to the fact the series is very very funny.


Art: 7

Not much to say about the art, it's decent and I don't think it will put anyone off the anime. One complaint I have is that Yamada is called the best looking girl in her school but she doesn't really look that good (this is subjective though)


Sound: 7

The soundtrack is not memorable to say the least. But the one thing I did like was the Opening music, the opening music is just your typical high pitched girl singing but I still found it quite cute and catchy to listen to. As far as voice acting goes, there was nothing memorable about it, but they did a fine job.


Character: 8

I give this an 8 because I think Yamada is a  good character, this is mainly due to the fact that she is the star of the show and she's the one who makes the show what it is. She makes the show entertaining as it is often her actions and words which cause the viewer to laugh, which is, in my opinion, what the show is mostly about - Comedy. Other than Yamada though the anime suffers from a weak and unmemorable supporting cast as the attention is usually focused on Yamada. At times one maybe be able to empathize with the male lead Kosuda as his thoughts do have some semblance to what teenaged males would think but due to the fact that he is the "Average Guy"  he is mostly unmemorable too.


Enjoyment: 10

Now this is the section I'll give a 10 in. As I said before B Gata H Kei is a hit and miss, and it purely depends if you enjoy it right? The thing that makes B Gata H Kei what it is (which is entertaining) is the humor that is employed throughout the series - I showed my friend this anime and he was cracking up the whole time throughout the whole series. The anime is a hit and miss is because the comedy that is employed is more of a Dumb kind of funny rather than the Smart funny many people may be used to and so they tend to shun it as most of the times the jokes made are sex jokes and sleazy jokes and what not. Smarter people may not enjoy this series as much due to this, and indeed there are many people like that, so this series may not be for everyone in that respect. But personally I found B Gata H Kei a very fun anime to watch because of it's humor and the main lead Yamada and every episode I was left craving for more, I still wish there was a second season.


Anyway I still feel guilty for liking this anime as me and my friend took it as a joke at first, but I'm glad I watched it. For all those people like me who only watch one genre (for me it's josei and shojo romance) I recommend you to take a break and try something new for once, or for anyone looking for laughs and a good time watch B Gata H Kei, I highly recommend it.

I was surprised when I saw the first 3 episodes. You don't expect a girl to be the perverted one! But damn it's funny!! Yamada is a wonderful character that you will love! She's weird but adorable. If you're into awkward situations where the boy is completely uncomfortable and the girl is obsesses with sex, This is your anime. It had a cute ending, some people might hate it because it doesn't follow the same idea as the rest of the anime but I happy endings!

Where do I start with this anime? To be honest, I was really unsure while starting this anime, I rarely watch this genre of anime in the first place. 
Let's begin shall we? 
Story: 7/10
When I first read the Summary I felt a sense of "Why exactly am I going to watch this?". The idea of a 15 year old girl wanting to have sex with 100 men seemed to be a bit far fetched, but none the less entertaining in it's own way. Not exactly something I would prefer, though. 
One could argue that it's a pointless plot but in my opinion it makesfor an interesting story. Because to tell you the truth watching her fail at her goal and trying different ways of achieving it was indeed very funny. Through out the series the main character 'Yamada' tries to have her way with a certain boy named Kosuda, who happens to be a virgin just as she is. If you enjoy comedy Ecchi, then this series is for you 


Art: 6/10 

The animation/art work of this series is very...Colorful, I'm sure that is apparent. Bright colors is commonly seen through out the show. To be honest though, I didn't see any part of the art work that really caught my eye and make me say "That animation" xD. 


The style of the characters is very appealing, and it doesn't look disgusting. I've seen a few ecchi anime's. And some of them created a very, erm, distracting, form of animation. Over all I find the art work to be nice to look at and not overly flashy. 


Sound: 5/10

...I didn't exactly think that the music series was bad per say. But I didn't see anything that really stood out for me in a way that I would listen to it over and over. However, I will say that the theme song was very catchy. But really the sound wasn't very unique, it had a very moe kind of feeling to it. Which isn't exactly surprising given that it is an Ecchi anime.


Character: 9

LET ME JUST SAY THESE CHARACTERS ARE FUNNY AS HELL. 


None of the characters that I have met in this series have been boring, dull, had no personality, or do nothing. The amount of character development in this series is fabulous as well. I feel the need to mention this considering the plot line. You'd expect the main character to be sorta slutish (Forgive me for using that term .-.) and vain. But it's the opposite. 


Yamada is very nervous and self conscious, like as mentioned in the series a few times she thinks her vagina looks weird. I like how they treated her character and showed it in a very realistic way. When it comes to some one's first time having sex people aren't confident that they will do well, they don't really know what they are doing and are self conscious about their body. Yamada was a very realistic character. 


For this I give kudos to the person who came up with Yamada's character, and also with the rest of the characters too. 


Enjoyment: 7/10 

This anime was very enjoyable to me, but not really on my top list of favorite anime's. It's funny, romantic, fanservicey and really a mix of ecchi. 


Over all: 6/10 

I feel a little harsh giving it a 6, but to be honest I think that is what it deserves. Maybe it's because I'm not really a huge fan of Ecchi comedies. However I would indeed recommend this anime to anyone who is into this sort of thing. I do seem to find myself watching it over and over again. 


All though I would not suggest buying it (In my opinion it's not really worth it). Streaming it would be a good thing to go for. It's available on pretty much every anime site and it's on netflix as well. 


Lastly, when it comes to the dub. I personally don't see anything wrong with it. I am usually the kind of person who prefers dub, but I know when a bad dub comes along. If you watch it subbed or dubbed it's up to you, but if you are a person who prefers dub like me, the dub is just fine. 


Thank you for reading this, enjoy the anime :)

Now, you may be thinking: "What the heck? Why would you EVER give this series a 10? It's SO cheesy! It's full of stupid meta jokes and there is no real substance--just ecchi humor geared towards teenagers!" However, I am here to voice MY opinion on the show. This is my review of B Gata H Kei: Yamada's First Time almost directly after I've watched it the second time. I watched it for the first time in spring 2014 and now I have watched it once more in early spring 2016.
Let me start with my qualification for my rating of the art and sound (a9).


I am not qualified at all to evaluate the art quality of the show. I can't draw, let alone write neatly. However, the art style managed to appropriately complements the atmosphere of the show at any given moment, fitting in with the feeling of playfulness and hilarity when it came about and then wistfulness and melancholy when that came about. I found the over-exaggerated facial expressions to be a bit weird sometimes, but I think that's more of me growing up from the first time I watched the show. It fed into the hilarity, anyway. Also, the censorship of Kosuda's penis was one of the funniest things I've seen in a long time.

As for the sound, I am a bit more qualified, for I have worked with audio both in music and general audio engineering for over four years at this point. I have to say that the sound effects were hilarious and I absolutely loved the silly background music. I also really enjoyed the laments that played when there was a sad or conflicting moments... they felt very real. I have no complaints on the voice acting; I liked how everyone sounded.


I will now move on to the rest of the criteria, which I have rated all a 10.


When I first watched this show, I had not experienced any super-awkward first time. I had never had a super-magical experience with a person that left me confused and frightened and nervous and yet, ecstatic. However, now that I have, my view on this show has changed dramatically. I once thought that the show was a cute rendition of what life as a teenager was really like. I thought that it was funny and cute and a tease for its ending, but now, I see this show more for what it really is. It's more than a cute, embarrassing comedy. It's my experience as a teenager.


When I rewatched this a couple days ago, I almost started crying multiple times in the middle of a couple of episodes. This was because it reminded me of what my life felt like when I first fell in love. I remember feeling apprehension and denial yet eagerness for what could possibly happen the next day when I saw that person who made my chest felt light. I remember the awkwardness of the first time and how much ridiculous planning teenagers might have to put in (especially when they really, actually care about the person). I am no longer with the person I mentioned before, and so this show served as a reminder of how great and magical my life was. I remember the beginning of that relationship as the most amazing, shiny, perfect time of my life. The feelings that both Yamada, the show's protagonist, and Kosuda, the show's co-protagonist, feel are very real and they are experiences I had. Jealousy, love, wistfulness, lust, sadness, and despondence are all things that come together in the search for a wholesome relationship, and I remember it. 


Now, with all that said, I give the characters a 10 just because there are real-life parallels for all of the major ones. You have the two (possibly unlikely) lovebirds, the supportive and guiding friend, the group of doubtful bystanders (especially in the culture of boys), the people who interfere and cause each lovebird to get jealous, and, of course, the driving force of their motives. All of these characters make true-to-life appearances and really make this show feel real.


I gave the story a 10 because it's really what happens. That kind of progression of emotions does happen. It's so accurate to the young teenage experience that it almost perfectly parallels mine (and I mean it! Down to almost the last detail!).  It's exciting, funny, attractive, depressing, and ultimately, relatable. I loved and still love it.


I gave the enjoyment a 10 for obvious reasons--I was invested the whole time, both times I watched it. I never got bored. It never ceased to suck me in and pluck my heartstrings in both happy and sad ways.


Overall, it's a 10. The combination of relatable realism in the teenage high-school experience, fitting music, characters who don't feel fake and acted, and a sense of humor so self-aware that it puts the antagonists of I, Robot to shame makes this anime series one of my absolute favorites so far (and I don't think I'll ever consider it otherwise). I love it so much. This show embodies the true emotional rollercoaster that is high-school.

Being honest, the first time I heard of this anime I kinda frowned. Being more of a conservative man, I did not find that it would be nice to see a girl planning on having sex with 100 guys.

B-gata H-Kei is exactly what you would expect from your typical ecchi romance anime. That's basically it.
The premise of this anime is actually quite interesting and different. I would go as far as to call it fairly daring, considering it's quite hard to pull off (Which is very visible in the anime itself, sadly). It's basically about a girl who wants to have sex with 100 guys as quickly as possible, even though she is not experienced at all. Now I personally don't enjoy ecchi too much, but this premise made me give this one a shot anyway.
The art is alright, though a bit dated.It'll do for a story like this, but it isn't very impressive. The sound however is quite mediocre, and I'd say that it refrains from using anything interesting, which makes the entire track quite forgetful.


The characters are where the anime breaks it for me though. To not spoil anything, aside from our main protagonist we have 'the first guy to have sex with' who play a main role in this anime. The thing is, that even though our main girl has a set goal, as explained in the premise of this story, she immediately ditches it because she is too shy (somehow suddenly?). Therefore it is hinted that she is in love with this bland guy even though she has no reason to be. The guy itself is extremely emotionless, and just reacts to everything the same way. Even though the anime itself is quite short (12 episodes) there is basically no character development at all, even though there relationship somehow improves. This makes little sense to me, but maybe I'm being harsh, that's for you to judge.


Overall the enjoyment was pretty good though, you can certainly watch it for a bit of comedy. The jokes are executed well and even though I never laughed out loud, there were some slight nose exhales here and there. If you love ecchi, you want to give this one a shot, otherwise I can only recommend it if you have no other comedies to watch. The romance is quite poor, and they stepped back on the interesting premise, but you can still enjoy it, and I suppose that's what it's about.

This was the beginning of my anime journey, and has since made me realize what   a unique experience it was watching this, at 1 in the morning, laughing to the point of pain. I have since re-watched this anime many times. I love the way the developed yamada's character, but still maintaining the crazy factor in the character's personality. I love the art style but i don't think it was allowed to be expressed fully as can be seen in the OP as you can see how water was animated. Overall, this anime is downright hilarious as the main character yamada is aperverted female rather than the typical male protagonist, this leads to lots of laughs and some unique scenes not found anywhere else because yamada is the pursuer.  Great anime, great voice acting from English and Japanese actors, great characters. 10/10\n

Ah feels good to write reviews again. After I went trough a dozen of animes,which had nothin' to write home about, this gem popped up. Well not as much popped as recommended by a friend. It is not 'til I saw couple of episodes that I've noticed the gem was made out of plastic and food coloring.
Now that intro might've made you think I despise this anime and you'd be wrong to think so you silly slacker. I most certainlydon't understand the appeal of ecchi animes but I guess some people just really like being blue balled for twenty minutes. Maybe it's a Japanese thing, maybe you need samurais and two nukes in your country's history to understand the appeal of it. Anyhow B Gata H Kei is a story about a fifteen year old girl who wants to shag a hundred guys during her time in highschool,I guess story goes for the realistic portrayal of fifteen year old girls. This does not mean she wants to do 'em in highschool,tho that would certainly liven up history lessons. The problem with this story is that it quickly turns into a generic romance. It checks couple of cliches during it's run. There's also a tsundere aspect to the female lead. Despite her being so keen to nom on some German sausage she gets extremely shy when it comes to instigating it with male lead. Speaking of him he'd probably be a background character in any other anime considering his lack of personality traits,wait actually that'd put him as a protagonist of a shounen all he needs is to shoot lasers. He's shy of course but it doesn't help much that female lead behaves like she's on a constant sugar rush. Whenever she talks to him it ends up as incoherent yelling. In couple of cases she berates him for being too slow with groping her tits. Yes you heard me well there's tiddies in here so if that's nuff for ya you can just stop readin'. In truth when they are closest to sex is when anime is the best. See this anime sells itself as a comedy but humor is pretty repetitive and generic. ,,Look at this pretentious asshole over here'', the villagers yell, ,,are titty jokes not good enough for you?''. Nope I've laughed at quite a number of titties in my life and problems aren't what they are joking about. Indeed jokes would be funny if comedic timing and execution weren't so bad, also I would be a good person if not for my apathy and disdain for humankind. But again during near sex scenes humor goes up with some interesting imagery, wink wink nudge nudge. Overall humor is hit and miss, more miss than hit.  It is also a romance,as you might've assumed, and it fares better in that department. Even though it contains a number of cliches, like male lead having a childhood friend that likes him and there being a girl who likes her older brother, it's certainly better than many others and I'll tell you why in a jiffy. See in the beginning female lead is only after male one cause she wants her first time to be with a virgin. However trough these twelve episodes she starts liking him for what he is, more or less. The thing tho is that characters in this anime are pretty eh. Eh in a manner that most of them don't partake much in anything. They all have one joke tied to them. For example there's a short, flat chested girl who wants to have a boyfriend really bad but nobody wants to date her and there's a classic clumsy girl who apologises a lot. Art is good. It's not too plain as some other things I've reviewed so I gotta pet it for that. Sound is basic and that opening makes me nauseous.\n
 Enjoyment is certainly present in this claptrap tho if you've already seen a decent amount of shoujo animes, which to a normal human being is below two, you won't find much new. I'd like to note tho that this is not what I consider good. Writing overall was pretty poor and seemed to repeat itself a lot. It still has that stinky air of by the book anime intersected with couple of lines that diverge from the norm. There's not a point where I felt engaged with the story to the point I actually focused on the screen. Better luck next time whoever wrote this.

I, for one, enjoy ecchi shows. So when I glanced at this show, I thought I'd binge it. What I got... was an interesting piece of work. Not the worst, but just not the best. 
Story: 5/10
The story was indeed ridiculous, I have to admit, but I liked it nonetheless. Wanting to have sex with 100 guys right as you get into high school. The only real problem is... it doesn't seem to go anywhere with the story premise. It had a unique idea, but it just didn't really use it. 
Art: 7/10
This art style fits this story quite well. The face that the simplecharacter designs compliment the smooth animation show that this was intended from the beginning. It isn't something I'd remember forever, but it certainly was a nice show to look at while it lasted.


Sound: 7/10


I adored the sound in B Gata H Kei, and for good reason. With people like Yoku Shioya and Junpei Fujita, your sound is going to be pretty good. Shioya was known for Sound Director of Welcome to the NHK as well as voicing Ryota Miyagi from Slam Dunk, while Fujita worked on some of my favorite theme song arrangements. Those include: Rosario + Vampire, Mirai Nikki OP2, and all of the music for all the Grisaia series. Their skills are apparent and make the sound very enjoyable. And the OP; just a great time!


Characters: 2/10


The characters of this show really killed the experience for me. They are just... dull. They're not all that likable, as none of them you can really relate to. None of the characters are ones that people will remember forever and ever, as they just aren't really fleshed out properly. And because of this, the characters feel incomplete. It's even harder to enjoy watching because you know less than you thought you knew. 


Enjoyment: 2/10


I did not particularly enjoy myself watching this show at all. It just felt like watching another average ecchi show, but with no ecchi. It felt like it was trying to emulate an ecchi show to me. I wouldn't consider re-watching this show, unless I needed to do a new review on it. And nothing is very memorable at all.


Overall: 6/10


Like I said before, not the worst, but certainly not the best. It could have used some changes on a few things, and maybe it would have turned into a solid 8.

"It's cute, funny, fan servicey and worth a watch"

The story is a weak point. It's funny and has a good premise, but let's not avoid the elephant in the room. If Yamada wanted to get laid it's not that hard, Even in sexually repressed nation like Japan.

The only thing I want to mention here is this series has one of the mostannoying theme songs I've heard in years.\n

BGHK has the Rosario+Vampire cute appeal!!!
Long reviews waste your time, so here's a short sweet paragraph. 
Comedy, ecchi, and romance are the spotlight genres here. BGHK's story slays these dragons with ease. The story pours mountains of comedy onto you in the form of dirty dialogue and embarrassing situations. Ecchi is always supported of course by our female lead trying to burn her v-card realizing she has no idea what she's doing; and the romance that develops will exceed your expectations. The characters are adorable and shy without becoming annoying like these characteristics tend to become. The male MC was pretty dull but the restof the characters make up for it well. Yamada is so nuts it's beautiful! There's no problem with the artistic vision of this anime. The coolest thing about each episode is it felt like you were watching 2 every time. You'll see what I mean. The soundtrack is adorable and the intro is soooooo catchy. I loved it. Bottom line is, if you're looking for something cute and funny to watch that is similar to Rosario+Vampire then this is for you. Enjoy!


Pros:

-Cute and adorable story.

-Positive vibes.

-Extremely funny!

-Catchy soundtrack/intro.


Cons:

-Not quite the ending you want.

B Gata H Kei is by far one of the most fascinating animes I have ever watched. Well, it is extremely ''unique'', and I have never seen anything like it. It was unexpectedly enjoyable, despite it's extremely perverted nature. i especially am surprised Yamada and Kosuda went so far without the whole ''plan'' backfiring. Yamada, in my opinion, is a very ''special'' character. She has very ''interesting'' ambitions. Regardless, her ambitions did trigger many of the funny moments. Kosuda is a very ''unique'' character as well. Perverted, yet so dense. (Oh so VERY dense). There were moments where i did think that Miyano deserved Kosuda,but then I thought ''Kosuda is exactly what Yamada needs to balance out her personality''. Overall, I really think this anime is worth watching, and many of it's twists can make your blood run. I'm really hoping a second season will be developed.

This is probably one of the most perverted and one of the most funny anime I have ever seen. It is also very original, this is the first series I have seen where the main character is a hot and perverted girl, its usually one or the other. This show is so damn ridiculous, it makes fun of EVERYTHING about romantic comedies, from the stereotypical rich pretty boy to hot high school girls. It is definitely a show worth anybody's time. And the jokes in the show also never gets old, even though it is repeated through out the series. The show is never bland,and it stays as perverted as ever all the way through. I can't really find that many big flaws in this one, but at times it does make it feel like having sex in highschool is mandatory for anyone who isn't ugly. This show is definitely worth watching though, it is ridiculously funny and perverted, but it also has its sweet moments. For the main part though, it is mostly funny and perverted, which I love, man shit, this show is awesome.
